loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es: Olga de 30 años de edad es propietaria de una tienda hace 7 años, producto de la tradición familiar pues siempre se han dedicado a las actividades comerciales. Su hermano fue quien inició su negocio  y después lo entregó a Olga, quien hoy vende de contado, todos los días, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector y su meta es tener un mayor surtido para ganar más dinero, pues sueña con terminar su carrera profesional, aunque su máximo desafío sea lograr incrementar su capital de trabajo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, bebidas, entre otros artículos de la canasta familiar, que diariamente compran sus clientes vecinos y que rotan fácilmente. Con esta inversión ampliará el sufrido de su oferta y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva, sea una exitosa inversión.
texts.en: Olga is 30 years old, and she has owned a store for 7 years. This arises from a family tradition, because her family members have always dedicated themselves to commercial activities. Her brother was the one who started the business, and he later transferred it to Olga. Today, she sells goods on a cash basis, every day of the week, working from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. Most of her customers are neighbors in the area. Her goal is to have a broader inventory of products in order to earn more money, since she dreams of completing her professional degree. However, her greatest challenge is to successfully increase her working capital. This is the reason that she is requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it, she will buy groceries, meats, beverages and other basic staple goods which her customers from the neighborhood buy every day and which turn over easily. With this investment, she will expand the variety of her offerings, and this is precisely why her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy groceries, meats, beverages, and other basic staple goods.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old. He is married with six children aged between 1 and 18 years. Three of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past twenty years, while his wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, de 29 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 están estudiando, los últimos 2 se quedan en casa porque están muy pequeños, en su casa solo vive con sus hijos y su esposo.

Lorena, ha trabajado desde hace mucho tiempo procesando café en una cooperativa, su esposo también trabaja en la misma cooperativa, esta es la fuente de trabajo más amplia de la zona y en los tiempos libres se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos para el consumo de la familia.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se acerca la época de cultivar y tiene que ir preparando la tierra, para obtener una mejor cosecha.

El sueño de Lorena, es tener mejor rendimiento y calidad de sus cultivos y asi poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorena is 29 years old, did not study, and is a married mother of five children. Three children are studying and the other two stay at home because they are very young. Their family lives together in their home.

Lorena has worked a long time processing coffee in a cooperative, and her husband also works in the same cooperative. This is the source of most work in the area. She spends her free time sowing basic grains for consumption by the family.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of farming supplies, as the time to cultivate is approaching, and she needs to prepare the land in order to obtain a good harvest.

Lorena's dream is to have a better yield and quality of crops and thus give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Amizero Group

texts.en: AMIZERO is a group led by Astherie who is 64 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 4 and 18 years. They all go to school. The group name means “Faith” in English. She sells fish and has been working in this business for the past 34 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more small fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more small fish to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking smallholder farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is also a wife, married for 21 years, and the mother of three children.

Catherine's farm is 1.25 acres. Her diverse farming activities include dairy, poultry, pig, goat, and horticultural farming. She also has 20 trees planted on her property. She makes an excellent profit from growing bananas and vegetables. That is why she is focusing most of her time on expansion of her horticulture section.

Catherine is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to grow more crops on her farm. She will spend the money to pay for farm inputs. By the end of the season, she will realize a significant increase in the volume of yields resulting from your investment.

The long-term goal for Catherine and her husband is to improve the living standards of their family and send their children to good schools that offer quality education.

loans.use: to grow more crops

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 58 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Teodora is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teodora has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Beatitude Group

texts.en:
Armed with some tailoring skills, a sewing machine, little capital and lots of optimism, Oxceria’s dream was to become a household name in creating interior decorations. Her focus was fixed on making bedspreads, seat covers, cushions, and curtains. In recent years, she has been able to open her own shop, selling the products that she produces from her home. Her client list includes NGO’s, small and medium companies, and the locals. 

The economic meltdown here in Zimbabwe made it difficult for her to keep the shop open, leading to its closure. As she struggled to keep her tailoring enterprise open, Oxceria heard about Thrive microfinance. In the beginning, she gained basic life skills that among other things helped her gain confidence in herself and set her goals to become a successful entrepreneur. She then went on to apply for a group loan with her friends after completing training. She has not given up her dreams of making her own interior décor name. She hopes that a loan from Kiva will help her buy a heavy-duty sewing machine and establish a successful name in the interior décor industry.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Catheline, a 45-year-old married mother of three children ranging in age from nine to 17 years, leads the group called ABISHYIZEHAMWE, which means “Altogether” in English. The members all sell different products and wish to expand their businesses to improve their futures. 

Catheline has been selling vegetables for 22 years. With her loan portion, she plans to buy more vegetables to sell. She will use her profits to pay her children's school fees and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vasita

texts.en:
Vasita is 22 years old. She is married with two children, who are one and three years old. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past five years. Her husband is also a farmer.

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a new house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en:
Wellars is 33 years old. He is married with three children, who are between three and 10 years old. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 15 years. His wife is also a farmer.

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his family's welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37 year old father of five who owns a well-known fruits and vegetables shop inside a Palestinian refugee camp in North Lebanon. He has been married for more than fifteen years to his wife who also grew up with her family in the same camp. 
Ahmad has always worked in different fields. However, his wife being unemployed, he established his current business at the end of 2013 in order to ensure a regular source of income and provide his kids with education and decent living conditions inside the camp. Moreover, he is always seeking to increase his household's by working as a house painter during his free time. 
Ahmad is asking for a loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy a new refrigerator that will allow him to preserve his products' quality in a fresh environment and satisfy his loyal customers.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to preserve his merchandise

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 25 year old Palestinian refugee who was born and raised in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. His parents are separated and he lives with his mother and two younger brothers. His mother is unemployed while one of his brothers works in a sweets factory and the other in the construction industry.  
Ibrahim has been working as a painter for more than five years after completing a training program at a technical institute where he learned the job. He is engaged to a young Palestinian refugee who works in a clothes shop.  
Ibrahim is hardworking and ambitious. He is asking for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to buy an extension ladder that he is now renting. The loan will therefore decrease his equipment rental costs and increase his monthly revenue which will allow him to become more sustainable. 
This improvement in his financial situation will boost Ibrahim at different levels. He will be able to continue supporting his mother while starting to make plans for his own family.

loans.use: to buy an extension ladder and other painting equipment

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat, 68, lives in a small community in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has two married children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 2.00 per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small and it can provide less benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford to do so. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living condition. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Caroline`

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be optimistic.

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of fish.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and iceboxes for storage.

Her business goal is to own a cooler within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and ice boxes for storage.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and five of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members.

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses and farming. She has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses. Rose lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utilities.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 53 years old and married with three children. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries.

In the future Gina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Josephine, who is 32 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain knowledge from the training they offer on how to operate and manage her enterprise and also to borrow funds and improve her business.

She does poultry farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds, which will increase her production and income.

She is grateful to Kiva as she will be able to expand her poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds to increase her poultry production and income.

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Yum is a 48-year-old married rice farmer with three dependent children. She has been a farmer since 2000. One of the children is a factory worker and two others attend school. Her husband is 51 years old and also a rice farmer. The family lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Together, they can make an income of $7 per day. 

Yum would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work. With this loan, her child will be able to have better traveling conditions. In the future, Yum wants to buy more soil to fill the big hole behind her house and support her two children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Kim Oan

texts.en:
Kim Oan, 42, is originally from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. To make a living, she opened a grocery store to serve people in her community. So far, she has been in this business for 20 years and earns, on average, an income of USD 10 a day.
She resides a little bit far from a water source so it is hard and time consuming for her to get water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a KIVA loan to dig a well for household use. With the supporting of this loan, she hopes that she can get water more quickly and more easily. She is thankful for the lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée 16 avril 2010. La plupart des femmes font du commerce et l'embouche.
FATOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère 3 enfants dont une fille et 2 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter des moutons. Elle achète 3 à 4 moutons selon les prix du marché qui varient entre 20 000 et 25 000 FCFA. Elle les engraisse et les revend à 35 OOO FCFA.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à acheter des vêtements pour les enfants et aussi s'occuper d'elle même pour ces besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group has 21 members and belongs to the banc villageois created on April 16, 2010. Most members work as vendors and raise livestock.
Fatou, the one standing on the right raising her hand in the photo, is 30 years old, married and has three children: one daughter and two sons.

With this loan, she will buy sheep. She buys three or four sheep, depending on the market prices, which range from 20,000 to 25,000 West African francs. She fattens the sheep and later resells them at 35,000 francs.These revenues will allow her to buy clothing for her children and also cover her own personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Kolo

texts.en:
Kolo is a 21-year-old single salesperson who is from the Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. He has been working as a salesperson in the city since 2013, earning approximately $7 per day. 

He is also pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in electricity engineering in his first year at a university. Due to the fact that he is lacking the finances to pay his first-year university fees, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to go through the first year at the university successfully. For Kolo’s dreams, he wants to become a good electrician and save money to run a business selling electrical equipment.

loans.use: to pay his first-year university fees

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is married with five children, and all her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, flour, cassava, and charcoal. She generates additional income from selling water and cold drinks. She works at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She would like to build her own house. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, flour, cassava, and charcoal

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is 39 years old and supports a family of six members. His wife is a housewife, hence does not provide additional income for the family. 

Of his children, two are in high school and two in upper primary school. 

He has asked for this loan to purchase a new motor bike for transport so as to earn an income from it and be able to provide for his family as well as educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor bike

loans.name: Presel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Presel works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and e-loading.  

Presel is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to  buy more sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Presel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenelyn is 56 years old and has one child is still in school.

Jenelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Perla requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat.

Perla has been in this business for three years now, and also earns an additional income from weaving.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat.

Helen has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernadith is 37 years old, and has one child in school.

Bernadith has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Bernadith has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is 45 years old and lives in Wihdat; she is married with six children. She wants to meet the needs of her children, and to complete their education to be successful people in the future.

All that depends on the financial situation for her family, so Majeda started a business in her house nine years ago. She is selling blankets to her neighbors and her family, but lately her husband is facing a financial problem because of the rise of the cost of living.  

Therefore she decided to expand her work to increase her income, but she needs your support and because of that, Majeda asked for a loan to help her buy more products and blankets to sell.  This will help her to help her husband more.

loans.use: To buy more products and blankets

loans.name: Adolphe

texts.en:
Adolphe is aged 32 years. He is married with two children, aged between 2 and 4 years; they are not yet go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past 11 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is 45 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 5 and 23 years. Six of them go to school. 

He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 29 years. Also his wife is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 34 years old. He is married with five children who are between 1 and 11 years old. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 16 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 36 years old. She is married with five children who between 1 and 14 years old. Three of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 21 years. Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household items, shoes, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Maturui Economic Empowerment Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Peter, a member of the Matarui Economic Empowerment Community Based Organization. He is married and has eight children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped him improve his knowledge in business management.

His economic activity is dairy farming. He needs a loan to buy high quality fodder for his cows. 

This will increase their milk production, and help Peter keep up with the increased demand for milk. He hopes this will increase his level of income so that he can be in a position to continue supporting his family, and in the long run improve their living conditions, including quality housing. 

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fodder that will help improve milk production

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Snoul district of Kratie province, Thida is aged 33 years and married. She has three children; two are in school while another one is too young for school. To support the big family, she and her husband have been growing cassava and work for others for a fee for 10 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Thida has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and for her children’s education. 

Now she and her group members are applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the field for growing cassava. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to plow the field for growing cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in roof tiles, wood, brick, and cement, in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 32 años, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 2 meses, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, feliz, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Chasquipampa’ un área residencial al sur de la ciudad, dónde antiguamente se pastaban las ovejas del lugar, de clima templado y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 9-19 grados centígrados. 
Patricia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con su bebé, viven en la casa de su suegra en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; hamburguesas, carne a la parrilla, chorizo y otros, labor que realiza 2 veces al día; para la hora de almuerzo y cena. “inicie mi negocio como ayudante de cocina, luego conseguí un préstamo y abrí mi propio negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios, la desventaja es que por la zona existe mucha competencia. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante grande para tener 2 parrilleros, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor número de clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que patricia solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para abrir un restaurante grande para atender a mas clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 32-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 2-month-old son. Her business is selling food. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, optimistic, happy, responsible and hard-working. She operates her business in the ‘Chasquipampa’ zone, a residential area in the southern part of the city, which used to be a grazing area for sheep. The climate is temperate and dry, with daytime temperatures varying between 9 and 19 degrees Centigrade.
 
Patricia has brown skin and long black hair which she wears braided. She has dark eyes and is short in stature with a medium build. She dresses in the traditional style (hat, apron and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home with her family. She also speaks Spanish because of the overall culture and the business she carries out. She shares her life with her partner, who works in transportation, and with her baby. They live in her mother-in-law's house, in a rented room built of brick and cement. They have potable water, electricity and sewer connections. Her business is selling food such as hamburgers, grilled meat, sausages and others. She carries out her work twice a day, at lunchtime and dinnertime. "I started in my work as a kitchen assistant, and later I obtained a loan and opened my own business," she reports. The advantage of her business is that it has daily customers, but the disadvantage is that there is a lot of competition in the area. Her dream is to open a large restaurant with two grills. She wants to expand her business by purchasing tables and chairs so she can serve a larger number of customers. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 3 years during which she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Patricia is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to create a large restaurant and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to create a large restaurant to serve more customers.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Ave Fénix. 
En este lugar vive señora Fanny, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  15 y 7 años, el mayor  estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Fanny para salir adelante junto a su familia se dedica al comercio, ella hace un año surtió en su casa una tienda de víveres donde vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, helados, sodas entre otros productos, ella desde hace cinco años vende productos Yanbal  pero hoy lo hace en su local, así ella poco a poco surtió su tienda lo cual le está dejando muy buenos ingresos que le ayudan a mejorar su calidad de vida, su hija mayor y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, pero por lo general es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace más de 12 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su vida. Sus metas son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many, many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees, the members of the “Ave Fénix” [Phoenix Bird] communal loan group meet every two weeks.

This where Fanny lives. She is 44 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children, who are 15 and 7 years old. The oldest is in high school and the younger one is in school. Her husband works in commerce.

Fanny, in order to get ahead along with her family, works in commerce. For five years she has been selling all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, vegetables, fruits, ice creams, and sodas, among other products. And now she has a store were she can sell those products.  With the loans she has received, she has stocked her store, which is giving her good profits, which help her to improve her quality of life. Her oldest daughter and her husband help her in her work when they aren’t busy, but usually she is the one who spends the most time in the business. 

She will use this loan to stock the store. She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, lunch meats, and other products of daily use. She has been in the loan group for more than 12 years and she likes it because with the loans she can improve her life. Her goal is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, lunch meats, and other products of daily use.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 62 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población es amable, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, lencería, productos de bazar y bodega, su tienda está ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable. Victoria es alegre, amable y trabajadora, es una mujer que se esfuerza para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como ropa de temporada para incrementar su negocio, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia, lo que mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victoria, 62, lives in her own home in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on Peru’s northern coast.  Its population is friendly, and they are engaged in farming, trade, and ranching.

Victoria is engaged in selling clothing, lingerie, and retail and general store products.  Her store is located in her home, and she has a considerable number of customers.  Victoria is happy, friendly, and hardworking, and she is a woman who pushes herself to in order to have a better quality of life.  To increase her business, she is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise such as seasonal clothing.  This will permit her to offer her customers a wider variety of products and, in this way, generate more income for her family, which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as seasonal clothing in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 55 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

Cynthia has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 49 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Charito works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil, spices, shampoo, detergent, etc.

Charito has been in this business for 9 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil, spices, shampoo, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 38 years old with three children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, canned goods, home care products, etc.

Jenny has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, canned goods, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Gelma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma.Gelma works hard to support her family.

She does business buying and selling fish crackers in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening.  Ma.Gelma is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her fish cracker business.

Ma.Gelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her fish cracker business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 49 years old and married and she has ten children, five of whom are still in school.

Lilian is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Lilian requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilian has been in this business for 20 years now, and she has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a ton of fish to sell.

Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a ton of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a married woman and she lives in Rsaifeh. She is selling ready-made clothes in her home, and she started this business ten years ago.

She is an example of an ambitious and hardworking woman. She runs her business alone and she is doing her best to meet the needs of her family.

Hanady`s problem is the high price of the clothes. Her purpose of applying for the loan is to buy more ready-made clothes to sell and thus expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ready-made clothes to sell and thus expand her business.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 31 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 6 years. 4 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 15 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested their maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to pay more workers.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 46 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 5 and 25 years. 5 of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 29 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested their maize crop. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested their maize.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 33 years old. He is married with four children between 2 and 12 years old. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 13 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested his maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested his maize.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 28 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 6 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 12 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested their maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 66 años de edad tiene un taller de marmolería, donde fabrica, lápidas, mesones para baños y cocinas;  aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades, se ha convertido en su mayor desafío y por eso día a día se levanta pensando en diversas alternativas para lograrlo. Hace 25 años cuando inició su propio negocio en Noviembre del año 1989, lo hizo basado en la experiencia adquirida como empleado, por eso no lo pensó dos veces, cuando decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios agregándole toda su capacidad técnica,  para sostenerse en el mercado.  En la actualidad sus ventas las realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, vendiendo a crédito y de contado y comprando de contado a distribuidores de mármol, quienes le ofrecen precios muy competitivos. Su meta es dotar su microempresa de nuevas herramientas y remodelar su vivienda, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades. Hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mármol e insumos para pulir sus obras y para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Luis is 66 years old. He has a marble workshop where he manufactures gravestones and countertops for bathrooms and kitchens. Increasing his sales and profits has become his greatest challenge and so every day he gets up thinking about different ways to do it.

He opened his business twenty-five years ago in November of 1989 based on the experience he acquired as an employee. This is why he didn’t think twice when he decided to start his own business venture adding up all his technical abilities to sustan himself in the market.

Currently his sales are made every day from 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the afternoon, selling on credit or cash and buying in cash from marble dealers who offer very competitive prices.

His goal is to provide his small business with new tools and remodel his home with the idea of increasing his sales and profits. Today he has approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to take out a Kiva loan in order to buy marble and supplies for polishing his works and to make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy marble and supplies to polish his works

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena es una señora de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, su hija tiene 11 años y su hija 13 años y les gusta mucho estudiar y asistir a su centro educativo, Elena es una señora muy trabajadora que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja al jornal, Elena necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar chanchos los mismos que los tiene en chancheras, la mayor aspiración de Elena  es de mejorar su negocio y tener los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hijo he hija.
texts.en:
Elena is thirty years old, and a single mother.  Her daughters, who are eleven and thirteen, like studying and attending their educational center very much. Elena is a hard-working lady who raises small animals and works as a day laborer. 

Elena needs the loan money to purchase pigs like the ones that she has in the pig pens. Elena’s greatest aspiration is to improve her business and have the income to pay for her children's necessities.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is a 52-year-old living in Battambang province. She earns income to support her family via growing rice. This is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has fully repaid her past loan. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her living conditions and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and certified seed potatoes to grow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar solution for her stitching centre

loans.name: Cheson Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Zeddy, a member of Cheson women group. She is 55 years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and potatoes farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise and financial management. This has enabled her in budgeting and record keeping. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs i.e. fertilizer. This will boost her farm output, thus assisting her to cater for the family and manage her business well.

Zeddy is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will help boost her farm output

loans.name: Felicito

texts.es: Felicito de 48 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace muchos años elaborando estructuras metálicas actividad que realiza en su vivienda y le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive junto a su esposo y su grupo familiar en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar agradable donde vivir aunque sabe que le faltan mejoras por realizar. Felicito desea mejorar su vivienda ya que esta cuenta con paredes a media altura las cuales desea terminar de construir por lo que apoyado en sus ahorros Felicito logró comprar los materiales pero no fueron suficientes para pagar mano de obra por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para pagar mano de obra para mejorar las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Felicito, age 48, is a hard-working man who for many years has earned a living by making metal structures.  He carries out this activity at his home, and it has allowed him to provide for his family. He has lived with his wife and family in his own home for many years, and he feels thankful for being able to have a nice place to live, although it needs some improvements. 

Felicito wants to improve his home, as its walls are half up, and he wants to finish building them.  He managed to purchase the materials with his savings, but they weren’t enough to pay for labor, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to pay for labor, in order to improve the walls of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for labor to improve the walls of his home.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 55 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Romela has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Romela aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 47 years old and has six children presently in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Yolanda has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purcahse more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jean Baptise

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 31 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 15 years.His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested their maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 40 years old. He is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 17 years. 3 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 21 years. His wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested his maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.



The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is aged 41 years old. She is married with three children aged 6 and 10 years. They both go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past eight years, while her husband is a business man. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and sell it. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and sell it.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a 38-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Jackline has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jackline described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jackline’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 38-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of fourteen farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Margaret has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Margaret described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 11 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Abahuzamugambi Group

texts.en:
Abahuzamugambi is a group led by Elia who is 55 years old. The group name means “One target” in English. 

He is married with three children aged between 23 and 29 years who got married. He sells construction materials and has been doing this as a business for the past two years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more doors and windows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more doors and windows to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda hija de 12 años que cursa quinto primaria en la escuela de su comunidad llamada Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.
María una mujer trabajadora y amable que busca la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su casa, desde hace 4 años ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de abarrotes en su comunidad, con este pequeño negocio ha logrado apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa, María con esa amabilidad con la que a tiende a la las personas a logrado mucha clientela quienes lo buscan por cualquier artículo que necesitan, ella ha pensado surtir más su tienda para darle a la clientela un mejor servicio, por tal razón María solicita un prestamo que lo invertirá comprando mercadería como: arroz azúcar, aceite, recitos, refrescos y gaseosas.
María sueña con acceder a este crédito para incrementar su negocio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder comprar un terreno también apoyar a su hija en la escuela
texts.en:
Maria, the mother of a family, is 34 years old, and married with a lovely 12-year-old daughter who is in the 5th grade in her community school, called Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.

Maria is a hard-working and friendly woman who is seeking a way to help her husband by increasing household income. Since four years ago, she has operated a small grocery store in her community. Through this small business, Maria has managed to help her husband with added income. With the friendliness with which she attends to people, Maria has gained a large clientele who shop for whatever article they may need. 

Maria wants to expand her store's merchandise and to offer her clientele better service. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, snacks, soft drinks and soda water.

Maria dreams of using this loan to expand her business and, thus, to be able to improve family income, and to purchase a piece of land, and to help her daughter in school.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar,oil, snacks, soft drinks and soda water to expand the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en: Araceli lives with her husband and son. She owns a beauty salon inside a Mexico City market. She attends both men and women. She is asking for a loan to buy some supplies for her beauty parlor. She says that her biggest accomplishment is helping her husband with the family expenses and supporting her son.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She has owned a piggery business for five years and earns monthly from the business PHP 1,500 that helps them a lot for their family needs. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008. Recently she decided again to take a loan amounting PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the pigs. She always wants her business to be a successful one so that she can pay her obligation and at the same help her family with their living. 

Rosemarie's wants for the future are to save money out from her business and give her family a good living condition.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Leydy Vanesa

texts.es:
Leydy es una mujer joven de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, gentil, activa, dedicada, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarolla en la zona ‘kalahuira’ situada al noroeste de la ciudad, es el área más grande del municipio, los pobladores crían ganado ovino, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-16 grados centígrados.
Leydy es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza.  Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres, tiene una hermana mayor que estudia y también le colabora en los gastos universitarios, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento, y cuenta con energía eléctrica, recibe agua de un estanque cercano y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Plato paceño (papa, habas, choclo y queso frito), Fricasé (sopa de cerdo con maíz molido y ají), Chairo (sopa de chuño con carne de cordero), Llauchas (empanadas rellenas de queso derretido), Humintas de choclo (choclo molido con queso, envuelto en su chala; hervida u horneada) y otros., actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo en un cuarto en su domicilio habilitado como cocina y sillas en la calle para que los clientes puedan comer sentados. “mi abuela me enseñó a cocinar para que tenga un oficio y pueda independizarme…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante muy conocido, ella desea realizar renovar sus utensilios de cocina, como: ollas, cocina, cucharones, sartenes, cuchillos y otros, porque los que tiene ya no sirven. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Leydy solicita un préstamo para la compra de ollas, cucharones y otros utensilios de cocina para cocinar y ayudar a su hermana.
texts.en:
Leydy is a young woman who is 18 years old, single, and has no kids. Her business is the sale of traditional food. She is enterprising, friendly, active, dedicated, consistent, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is done in the ‘Kalahuira’ area, located northwest of the city. It is the largest municipality of the area. Many residents raise sheep. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day from 2-16 degrees Celsius.

Leydy has dark skin, long black hair tied back, brown eyes, short stature, and average physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará that she speaks in the family. Additionally, she speaks Spanish for general culture and for use in her business. Her life is spent at home with her parents. She has older sister who studies and she assists her with college costs. They live in a home built of brick and cement that has electricity. They receive water from a nearby pond and do not have a sewage system.

Her business is the sale of traditional food, such as: Plato paceño (potatoes, beans, corn, and fried cheese), Fricasé (pork soup with ground corn and chili), Chairo (potato soup with mutton), Llauchas (empanadas stuffed with melted cheese), Humintas de choclo (ground corn with cheese, wrapped in its husk, boiled or baked), and others. She works from Monday to Sunday in a room at home with a kitchen and chairs in the street so that customers can sit while eating. "My grandmother taught me to cook to have a job and be independent...", she says. Her dream is to have a popular restaurant. 

She wants to renew her cookware, such as pots, pans, knives, and others, because the ones she has no longer serve. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years that she has been doing this activity independently. It is for these reasons that Leydy asks for a loan to purchase pots, pans, and other kitchen utensils and to help her sister.

loans.use: to purchase pots, pans, and other kitchen utensils for cooking and help her sister.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William es el propietario de un almacén de repuestos y autopartes de vehículos. Él es un hombre de 55 años de edad y padre de dos hijos en las edades de 24 y 29 años, a quienes sueña con ver convertidos en profesionales de éxito.  
En el año 2010 un amigo de William le sugirió la idea de abrir un almacén para vender autopartes y repuestos para vehículos, como efectivamente lo hizo. Hoy es su principal generador de ingresos y su fuente de empleo, al que dedica un tiempo que va desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus compras las realiza de contado y así mismo sus ventas. William tiene una gran meta y es la de ampliar su cobertura de clientes, por eso requiere incrementar el stock de artículos como tornillería, pernos espárragos y autopartes. William es un hombre persistente, anteriormente tuvo dificultades con un vehículo que compro para tenerlo como su negocio, pero decidido a reponerse de sus pérdidas, continuó con el esfuerzo que lo caracteriza y paso a paso ha salido adelante.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tornillerías, pernos etc. Con esta inversión incrementará sus inventarios y potencializará sus ventas, como es el propósito de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
William is the owner of a store that sells spare parts and accessories for vehicles. He is a 55-year-old man and the father of two children, aged 24 and 29. He dreams of seeing his children become successful professionals. 

In 2010, a friend of William's suggested to him the idea of opening a store to sell spare parts and accessories for vehicles, and that is what he did. Today, it is his main source of income, and it provides him with work. He dedicates his time to the business from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He makes his purchases with cash, and his sales are on the same basis. William has a great goal, which is to expand his customer base. For this, he needs to increase his stock of goods, such as nuts and bolts, stud bolts, and car parts. William is a persistent man: previously he had difficulties with a vehicle which he had bought to use for his business, but he decided to recover from his losses; he continued with the hard work which characterizes him, and step by step he has made progress. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it, he will buy nuts and bolts and other items. With this investment, he will increase his inventory and strengthen his sales, in accordance with his plan for success with his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy nuts and bolts, auto parts and other items.

loans.name: Eida Marta

texts.es:
Eida es una mujer de 62 años de edad que desde el año 1992 tiene en la comodidad de su casa un negocio de confección, con este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia que la conforma dos hijos, siempre fue su único apoyo y hoy a sus 62 años madruga diariamente a dar sus puntadas a cada tela.
Ella es madre cabeza de familia y ofrece un empleo, con su compañera sueñan con tener un taller de confección y lo dicen entre risas pues la competencia en es fuerte pero bueno, un sueño que pueden cumplir si se lo proponen.
Eida inicio su negocio por una necesidad muy marcada, no conseguía empleo y los que conseguía eran por un jornal muy bajo que no daba para el sostenimiento de su familia es por esto que decidió montar su propio negocio y desde entonces ha creído que fue la mejor decisión de su vida.
Ella tiene sus sueños familiares, tener una casa propia, dejar el negocio a sus hijos que por su parte se lleven una herencia.
Eida en el momento se encuentra solicitando un apoyo financiero para la compra de una maquina familiar que necesita para lograr algunos acabados de tela que le están solicitando.
texts.en:
Eida, 62, has had a sewing business in her home since 1992, and it has helped her get ahead with her family.  She's the mother of four children.  It was always her only support and now she gets up early every day to sew.

She's a head of family and she employs one person.  She and her partner dream of having a tailor shop, which they say laughing because the competition is fierce, but it's a dream they can realize if they put their minds to it.

Eida started her business for a very definite need: She wasn't finding work and what she did find was for a very low daily wage that wasn't enough to support her family.  That's why she decided to set up her own business, which she has believed ever since to be the best decision of her life.

She has her dreams for her family: to have her own house and leave the business to her children so they have a legacy from her.

Currently Eida's requesting financial support to buy a domestic sewing machine, which she needs to put some finishing touches on some clothing to fill an order.

loans.use: to buy a domestic sewing machine to make some clothing

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jovelyn has a business of farming fruits in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is an amazing mother who lives in Irbid. She has three children and she is working hard to insure a good life for them and not to let them need anything.

Her husband is working as a driver with a low income so he could not cover all the needs for his family. Because of that, Fatima wants to help him in any way, and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she used her talents to start her business.

Fatima has talents that she learned from her mother since she was a child: she can make good soap and she knows how to sew clothes, and also she can arrange flowers in a unique way. She used all these talents to start her business many years ago.

Now Fatima wants to expand her work and buy the items she needs to increase the quality of her work in all the fields she works in. She applied for a loan to help her expand her work and to buy more tools and things that she needs to increase her products and sell them. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To help her expand her work and to buy more tools and things she needs for her business

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
Rosa, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales 1 estudia.

Rosa, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y cuida a sus hijos, pero también administra la tienda que tiene en su casa, también le ayuda a su pareja en los trabajos agrícolas, ya que es una mujer luchadora y está acostumbrada a realizar trabajos fuertes.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar azúcar, arroz, frijoles, jabón, lejía entre otros productos para la tienda y otra parte del dinero será para comprar insumos agrícolas.

Ella en la futuro quiere ampliar más su tienda e invertir siempre en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and studied through the seventh grade. She is in a relationship and has two children, one of whom is studying.

Rosa takes charge of the household duties and looks after her children. She also manages a store that is located in her home. Rosa also helps her partner with the farm work. She is a determined woman who is accustomed to performing hard work.

Her loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, beans, soap, bleach, and other products for her store. Part of the money will also be used to buy farming supplies. In the future, she would like to expand her store and keep investing in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, soap, bleach, and other products for her store, as well as farming supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman with four children. She is 54 years old, and she is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Fatima is selling blankets, which she bought from Aqaba, in her home. She started her business eight years ago. Fatima`s purpose in applying for the loan is to buy more blankets that she can sell in order to increase her income. 

Fatima`s future plan is to expand her business and open a shop for selling blankets.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for resale.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
A villager living in Battambang province, Nak is 51 years old. She does not have children. 

To support her family's conditions, she grows rice. For Nak, this is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loan. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to give more yields to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm

loans.name: Rugongo Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rugongo Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011, in order to benefit from Hand in Hand trainings on savings and entrepreneurship.
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ann. She is 45 years old, married, and living with three of her children. She does poultry farming and dairy farming. 
She is borrowing from Kiva to buy feed for her chickens and dairy cows. She feels that this loan will assist her in increasing her income level, hence she will be able to feed her family, provide good clothing for her children, and also pay their school fees.
She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and dairy cow feed

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Morn is 52 years old. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping. For Morn, this is her third cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) as she has fully repaid her past loans. 

Morn will spend her loan to purchase pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Ma. Araceli

texts.en:
Ma. Araceli, a 46-year-old married mother of a 10-year-old, has been a tricycle  operator for four years now.  A tricycle is the most popular means of transport in small towns and cities, especially in the rural areas.
