Ma. Araceli is requesting a loan to pay for the motorcycle franchise and  registration. With these, her income will improve and she will be able to provide proper diets to the family. 

Ma. Araceli hopes to expand her business to become successful and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to  pay for the motorcycle franchise and  registration

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en:
Sadaina is married with four children and two go to school. She has two additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

She sells used clothes on a retail basis at the market and has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She sells seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, home care products, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for ten years now. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Editha is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Editha has a business buying and selling flowers in the Philippines. Editha requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy flowers and other materials used in her business.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy flowers and other materials used in her business.

loans.name: Saludada

texts.en:
Saludada works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Saludada has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 30 years old and married with three children. With all her children in school, Mylene works very hard to provide for them.
Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, canned goods, and home product care goods.
Mylene has been in this business for 11 years now. 
In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, canned goods, and home product care goods.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old with five children. With three children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.
Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care goods, beverages, and groceries.
Maricel has been in this business for two years now. 
In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en:
Liberathe is 35 years old. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 12 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 21 years. Her husband is a also farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Humura Group

texts.en:
Humura Group is a group led by Juliette, who is 40 years old. The group name means “cool” in English. 

Juliette has been a group leader for two years. She is a tailor and has been doing this business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mapenzi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is aged 41 years. She is married with seven children aged between 3 and 20 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 21 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain undeserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes and products to sell

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, de 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, ya están casados y viven aparte, en su casa vive sola con su esposo y un nieto.

Genaro, se dedica a cuidar de una pequeña tienda que tiene desde hace 15 años, donde vende productos lácteos y bebidas.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, para preparar la tierra ya que se acerca la temporada donde ellos cultivan granos básicos como frijol y maíz para el consumo.

El sueño de Genaro, es que su cosecha sea muy buena y le genere buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Genaro, age 63, never had the opportunity to go to school. She is married and has three children, who are all married and moved away themselves. She lives with her husband and one grandson.

Genaro earns a living by tending a small shop that she's run for fifteen years, where she sells dairy products and beverages.

She needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies to prepare the land. It's getting to be about time when they plant staple grains like beans and corn for their own consumption.

Genaro's goal is to have a good harvest and earn a good income.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mary, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Mary joined One Acre Fund in 2011, because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Mary plans to send her children to school.

Among the seven farmers in Mary's Group, a total of 6.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, one of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nelson Arquimides

texts.es:
Nelson, de 37 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, está casado y es padre de 3 hijos, en la casa vive solo con su esposa e hijos.

Nelson, trabaja en una cooperativa cafetalera desde hace unos años, trabaja de lunes a viernes y su horario es de 4:00 a.m. a 1:30 p.m. y el día sábado lo trabaja hasta las 12:00 p.m.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que el sus tiempos libres trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando granos básicos para el consumo.

El sueño de Nelson, es obtener una buena cosecha y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson, age 37, went to school through the ninth grade. He is married and the father of three children. He and his wife and children all live together in their own home.

Nelson has worked for a coffee-growing cooperative for some years now. He works Monday through Friday from 4:00 am until 1:30 pm and on Saturdays until 12:00pm.

He will use this loan to buy farm supplies, since he farms in his free time, planting staple grains for his family's consumption.

Nelson's goal is to achieve a good harvest and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy farm supplies

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en:
A mother of a child living in Battambang province, Sakhorn is 51 years old. To support her family, she grows rice as a main source of income. This is her seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has fully repaid her past loans. 

She will spend her loan on the purchase of pesticides and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her life and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer to support her farmland.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Phally is 44 years old and the mother of two children. For her living, she grows rice as the main source of income. This is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has fully paid her past loans. 

She will spend her loan to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and rice seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and rice seed to support her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for the family business

loans.name: Rocendo

texts.es: Rocendo de 32 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que al no encontrar un empleo hace 5 años decidió sacar adelante a su familia apoyándose en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, pero además aprovechando la clientela vende productos de temporada. Él vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida desde hace varios años. Rocendo siempre buscando lo mejor y para provechar que inicia la época escolar ha tomado la decisión de invertir en productos de temporada, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bolsos, estuches para lápiz, bolígrafos, cuadernos, etc. Y de esta manera mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Rocendo, age 32, is a hard-working man, but upon finding no work for five years, he decided to get his family ahead by starting his own business selling clothes. He also makes the most of his customer base by selling seasonal merchandise. He lives in his own home along with his long-term partner. 

Rocendo is always looking for opportunity, and to take advantage of the start of the school year, he wants to get seasonal products. However, he doesn't have the cash on hand, which is why he's requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will use the loan to buy bags, pencil bags, pens, notebooks and more. Through this, he will provide his family with economic stability.

loans.use: buy school supplies for resale

loans.name: Jonie Roy

texts.en:
His name is Jonie Roy, 31, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and a hardworking young man that works on his own farm to support himself and his aging parents.

Jonie Roy has a cassava farm. Cassava grows best in a warm humid climate like the Philippines. It is one source of food and starch among Filipinos and it is not far from what rice and corn can offer. It is also deliciously made into cassava cake which is a favorite delicacy among the Filipinos. He sells his harvest to market and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which he will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his farm. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Jonie Roy hopes for his farm to flourish and to be able to buy a bigger farming land in the future. He prays for good health of his family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers for a productive harvest.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita  engages in fishing and sells a variety of fresh fish to the locals in the community. She is a 48-year-old married woman  with five children. Two of them are still attending school. She lives in Getafe, Bohol.


Nenita  is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. These will help Nenita improve her on-going catch and able to sell more fish. In this way , she could now prepare nutritious diets for the whole family. She could now finance the schooling of her children.   

In the future,  she  dreams of expanding her livelihood  to become sustainable and improve the status of the family as well.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is aged 42 years. He is married with five children aged between 4 and 20 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 21 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy drums of paint and thinner at wholesale

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julie runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julie has been in this business for 30 years, and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is 31 years old. He is married with three children aged between 1 and 7 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past ten years. Also his wife is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 48 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 4 and 25 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 23 years. Also her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 47 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is  a married woman and has three school-going children. They own a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Eunice operates a business selling paraffin for use in cooking at retail to neighbours. In addition she also operates a phone-charging business which earns her another source of income. She faces a challenge of delayed payments hence low profits in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to establish rental houses, to purchase cement and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Mahdeya

texts.en:
Mahdeya is an amazing mother to four children; she is working hard to provide them a good life.  She started her own business two years ago to help her husband with the household expenses that rise day after day.  She is selling home supplies and general products in her house.

Currently they are facing financial problems, leading Mahdeya to think of expanding her work.  

Therefore she asked for a loan to help her buy more products to sell and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Santos Pastor

texts.es:
Santos, de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, se casó y ahora es padre de 5 hijos, todos están casados y viven aparte aunque en el mismo lugar, pero todos tienen su propia casa.

Santos, trabaja en la agricultura y cuando es temporada cultiva maíz y frijol, deja una parte de la cosecha para el consumo y lo demás lo vende, para obtener ingresos y así invertirlo en otros gastos del hogar, también cuando es temporada de cortar café se dedica a eso, su esposa lo ayuda con el cuidado del hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, semilla y pagar mano de obra para la siembra.

El sueño de Pastor, es seguir trabajando y poder obtener mejores cosechas, para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, age 70, went to school through the fourth grade. He is married and the father of five children, all of whom are grown and live in their own homes nearby.

Santos is a farmer. When it's time to grow beans and corn, he sets aside part of the harvest for his family's own consumption and sells the rest, earning income to pay for the household expenses. When it's time to harvest coffee, he does that. His wife helps by tending the home.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers and seed and to pay for manual labor for planting. His goal is to keep working, achieve better harvests, and give his family the best possible quality of life.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seed and pay for labor

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Catherine; she is 42 years old, married, and has five children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013, where she learned more skills on enterprise development and financial management. Catherine has been doing dairy farming for the past three years. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan  to buy a dairy cow, since the demand for milk has gone high; she also wants to increase her level of income to continue supporting her family.

Catherine appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and help, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
A resident from Battambang province, Sokheng is 29 years old and a mother of three children. For her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. This is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loans. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland. 

She hopes that she can improve her family’s living conditions to be better than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Alice, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 46 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Alice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Alice says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. 

Alice will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by six farmers in Webuye District, and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three children. Mary has been a farmer for 18 years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 20-year-old single lady from Jenin city. She lives with her big family in a small house. Noor works in a clothing store, where she gets a low income. This income is barely covering the family needs. Noor is a student, studying finance. She would like to get a BA degree and find a better job in the future.

Noor took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installment for this semester. This will help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

Noor appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
Reyes tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región, Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de piña desde hace 25 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando los alimentos para los jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a su cultivo, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para el pago de mano de obra para la cosecha de su cultivo de piña, con esto Reyes espera mejorar su producción lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyes is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará, a community with a warm climate, whose population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.  It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra. 

He has worked in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of pineapples, for 25 years, and his wife supports him in this work by preparing food for the day laborers who maintain his crop. He has experience in this business, and good references in his district. 

He has requested a loan to pay for labor to harvest his pineapple crop. With this, Reyes expects to improve his production, which will generate more income for him, and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Rueben

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. Peter is a farmer, a business he has been in for the last 12 years.

Peter has applied for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to purchase farm inputs. He hopes this will help him produce food in bulk.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to pay his children's school fees and supply food to his community.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 30-year-old married lady from Jenin city. She lives with her husband and two sons in a small house. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he makes a low income. This income barely covers the family needs. Wafa is a student, studying finance. She would like to get a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Wafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installment for this semester. This will help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

Wafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros is a 58-year-old married rice farmer with two children. She lives in Kandal province in Cambodia. Her husband is a civil servant and also a rice farmer, and her two children are working in a factory. The family can earn around USD15.48 each day. 

Now Ros would like to request a loan to buy oxen for plowing. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy the oxen for plowing. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her rice farm to gain more rice crops.

loans.use: to buy oxen for plowing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy more groceries and supplies, which she needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business with a new loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages, which she needs to improve her business. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Myrna also operates a canteen business and maintains a house for rent. She is also a rice distributor within her community. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman someday. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.en:
Marisel works hard to support her family. Marisel is married and has a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Marisel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Marisel has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 8 years. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 11 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina works hard to support her family. Katrina is single and has a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Katrina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Katrina has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando de 68 años de edad  es viudo y padre de 5 hijos. En el mes de Febrero de 1994, atendiendo a su hermano fabricante de repuestos industriales en caucho,  y metalmecánica y quien le recomendaba aprender de él para que se defendiera en su vida, decidió trabajar con él por muchos años, alrededor de 10 y posteriormente se independizó, organizando una clientela con empresas reconocidas en la ciudad, a quienes les provee de contado y a crédito piezas para máquinas industriales , comprando de contado en depósitos de materiales de hierro  bronce y aluminio además de ferreterías. Su meta es lograr el mejoramiento de su taller adquiriendo maquinarias cada vez más especializadas y continuar apoyando a sus hijos y nietos para que tengan lo necesario. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara materiales y herramientas, como láminas galvanizadas y repuestos necesarias para aumentar la productividad y adecuar técnicamente el taller. Con esta inversión dará trabajo a otras personas y logrará captar nuevos clientes y cumplir efectivamente con los actuales, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Hernando is 68 years old, a widow, and the father of five children. He was helping his brother, who manufactured industrial metal and rubber spare parts, back in 1994, when his brother suggested that Hernando learn the business so he could earn a living. 

Hernando accepted his brother's advice and spent the next 10 years working in his brother's shop. Hernando then went into business for himself, building up a customer base of established companies in his city. Hernando buys raw materials such as iron, bronze, aluminum, and hardware, paying cash. He then provides industrial machine parts to his customers, who either pay in cash or buy on credit.

Hernando hopes to make improvements to his workshop by purchasing more specialized machines. He also wants to keep providing support his children and grandchildren, helping to meet their needs. Hernando is currently applying for a Kiva loan via the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and will use the loan funds for the purchase of materials and tools, such as galvanized sheeting and spare parts that he needs to boost productivity and make improvements to his shop. This loan will allow Hernando to employ more people, meet the needs of his current customers, and attract new ones. Hernando's loan will then be a success.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools, such as galvanized sheeting and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar solution for her business so she can increase her productive hours and income.

loans.name: Gadeer

texts.en:
Gadeer is a 33-year-old single lady from Ramallah city. She lives with her family in a small house. She works as a teacher in a public school where she makes a low income. This income is barely cover all her needs. Gadeer is also a master student ,where she studies ِArabic literature. She would like to get a Master's degree and improve herself in this field.

Gadeer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installment for this semester. This will help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

Gadeer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Kristin Grace

texts.en:
Kristin Grace is a mother of two children. She's 33 years old. 

Kristin Grace manages a buy-and-sell business of squid. She dries the squid and sells it. It is a good business for her family because she earns income of PHP 4,000 a month from this business and it helps them a lot.

Kristin Grace joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2014 and decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 to buy additional squid to sell, so that she can sell more and earn more income.

Her hope for the future is to have her own fishnet, so that she will not have to buy any more squid from her supplier.

loans.use: to buy additional squid to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a hard-working woman. She sews traditional women's dresses and covers for national-style cradles and is well known among her customers. She is a responsible, honest, confident and kind person. 

Jamila lives in poor conditions and has a lot of problems with day-to-day life. She wants to live better and be happy. Jamila is planning to buy wood, roofing slates and masonry for her house. She is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to buy these materials. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wood, roofing slates and masonry for her house

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 35-years-old and a married mother of 6 children.  She is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Regina has been a farmer for 12 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Regina wanted to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Regina hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, even though Regina decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 37 years old and lives in Dair Alla.  She lives in a very simple house with her family that consists of her husband and her five children.

Manal could not complete her education, so she is working hard to give her children all they need to complete their education and find good work. Her husband is working, with a low income. Because of the needs of his sons that increase day after day, he became unable to cover all household and educational expenses.  That led Manal to start her own business in her home, which is commerce in household supplies and general products. 

Manal wants to expand her work and sell clothes in addition to the house supplies. Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy clothes and more products to sell to increase her income to help her husband.

loans.use: To buy clothes and more products to sell

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, and is being represented by Rosemary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 29 years old, is married, and has one child. Rosemary has been a farmer for 10 years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Rosemary isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Rosemary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Rosemary's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is conservative married woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo. She is 31 years old and a mother of five children.

Somaya is helpful woman, and wants to help her husband in her household expenses.  Because of that, she has started her own business in her home. She is selling glass products and general household supplies.

Now she needs to expand her work, therefore she asked for a loan to help her buy more products to sell and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to help her buy more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and items for women in general.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rael, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 28 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.  She is married and has two children.

Rael is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Rael says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. 

Rael will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Ikbol

texts.ru: Икбол благодарит за поддержку. Она смогла удержать бизнес, и с тех пор значительно улучшилось жизненные условия семьи. Икбол параллельно начала заниматься растениеводством и сейчас готовится к завершению посева пшеницы. Она посеяла пшеницу, но ей сейчас надо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Но для достаточного количества минеральных удобрений у Икбол не хватает средств, и она приняла решение снова обратиться за кредитом. Она верит, что ее поддержат во второй раз, и заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ikbol thanks you for the support. She was able to retain her business and has since greatly improved her family's living conditions. 

In parallel, Ikbol started working with field crop cultivation, and currently she is preparing to complete the sowing of wheat. She has done the sowing, but she needs to process the land with mineral fertilizers. She does however not have sufficient money to get a large enough amount of mineral fertilizers, and she decided to again apply for a loan. She believes that you will support her again, and thanks you in advance for it.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to complete the sowing of wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fee installments for this semester.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom are attending school. She has no additional family members. Stella lives in her own house but has no access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Stella has operated a food stall, selling fruits and vegetables, at the market for the last 13 years, working seven days a week. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, oranges and onions. Her dream is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, oranges and onions to sell

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en 2007,regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village et ont en commun une responsabilité solidaire du remboursement de leur crédit.Elles ont en général comme activité l'agriculture.

Coumba qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 47 ans,est mariée et mére de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Son activité est le commerce d'arachide et de mil,elle s'approvisionne au niveau des marchés environnants son village et revend chez elle.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 05 sacs de mil de 50 kg de mil à 10000f le sac et 03 sacs d'arachide de 50kg à 15000f le sac.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,la nourriture et les frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, created in 2007, brought together women who live in the same village and have in common a united responsibility to pay back their loans.  In general, they work in agriculture.  

Coumba, who is on the right of the photo holding up her arm, is the head of the group.  She is 47 years old, married and the mother of 7 children, three of which are boys.  

Her business is with peanut and millet.  She gets a supply from markets around her village and resells the products near her home.  

With this loan, she can buy 5 50 kilogram sacks of millet for 10,000f each and 3 50 kilogram sacks of peanuts for 15,000f each.  

Her goal is to ensure education, food and health costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and millet to resell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a hard working man from Talibon, Bohol. He is a carpenter.  He is a 51-year-old man with two dependents ages 15 and 13, respectively. He has been engaged in this kind of livelihood for more than 10 years.

He is asking for a loan to buy tools used in his carpentry work. With these, he can concentrate doing his job well and provide quality output and services. He can now improve his earnings and be able to cater to the needs of his growing children. 

He is hoping that he would be able to expand his business so it can become more sustainable and also improve his family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy tools used in his carpentry work

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE PICHINGOTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maras, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Emilia se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y plátanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the 'Virgen Natividad de Pichingoto' communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Maras, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Emilia works in agriculture. She has a plot of land where she grows coffee and bananas. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Emilia has been in this business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her agriculture business. 

Emilia is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Her name is Herminigilda, 43, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a security guard. She is a mother of four children, of whom two work on a farm, one is in high school, and the youngest is still in the elementary level of school. She manages their household while operating a business to augment their income, to meet their everyday expenses. 

Herminigilda has an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines, like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, a variety of hanging plants, and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every day.

To help her expand her farm, Herminigilda is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and various kinds of garden seedlings to grow more healthy ornamental plants. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely help in meeting their daily needs and funding her children's education.

Herminigilda dreams for her ornamental business to flourish in the coming years. She aims to send her children to college and see them become professionals someday. 

Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and garden inputs.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is 65-years-old, married and has five children. She has managed a coconut production business for 11 years already.  It has been a growing business because she earns PHP 4,800 a month that helps her family with their living. She decided to take a loan again to pay for the labor cost for harvesting coconuts.

For the future, she wants to buy a tractor for her coconut farm for better production.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost for harvesting coconuts.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 49, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a vendor and they have five children.  She and her husband manage their household while they operate the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Marivic operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to help her continue to operate of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marivic hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Irene is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of grocery items to sell in her general store business.

NWTF is listing Irene's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, aged 53, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been operating a pig-raising business in the Philippines for 15 years. 

Julieta has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a married man and father of three children, living in Rsaifeh. He started his own business from the money he had. His business is a small beauty salon for men, which he opened after he gained good experience in working in this field in one of the salons. 

He is asking for the loan to get more requirements for the salon, and to buy what he needs to increase the quality for his work and increase his income.

loans.use: to get more requirements for the salon and to buy what he needs.

loans.name: Tazhihon

texts.ru: Тажихон, 59 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Тажихон среднее образование, она занимается полеводством и разведением скота. У нее в хозяйстве есть 1 корова. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает картофель и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На сегодняшний день деятельность Тажихон приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Tazhihon is 59 years old, married and has three children. Tazhihon has secondary education. She works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding. She has one cow on her farm and grows potatoes and sweet corn for own use and for selling on 2.0 hectares of land. Currently Tazhihon's business brings in a monthly income for 10,000 som (KGS). 

To further develop her business, Tazhihon turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow. She plans to use the income from the loan to develop her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 7 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 48-years-old and a married mother of 7 children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Everlyne has been a farmer for more than 30 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Everlyne wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Everlyne hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights, even though Everlyne decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Olga Esperanza

texts.es:
Olga, de 30 años de edad, está casada, su esposo es mecánico automotriz y tiene 2 hijos que actualmente están en la escuela. 

Olga, tiene 15 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, es una actividad que aprendió de su madre, quien era una mujer muy emprendedora y fue quien le enseño a desempeñarse en este negocio, sus hijos le ayudan a vender cuando salen de la escuela.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar granos básicos, para vender porque ha decidido agrandar su negocio, de esta manera podrá tener un mejor ingreso, para cubrir las necesidades que su familia le demande.

Los sueños que tiene para un futuro son: ampliar su negocio, además pretende poner venta de comida rápida, la cual será administrada por su hija, quien el próximo año se graduara de bachillerato y quiere apoyarla para que continue sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Olga, 30 years old, is married.  Her husband is an automotive mechanic.  She has 2 children who currently attend school.  

Olga has 15 years of experience selling basic household staple products.  It is an activity that she learned from her mother, who was a very enterprising woman and was the one who taught her to work in this business.  Her children help her to sell when they get out of school.  

The money will be used to purchase basic staple foods to sell because she has decided to make her business bigger.  In this way she will be able to have a better income to cover her family's needs.

Her dreams for the future are to expand her business and also to try to sell fast food, which will be managed by her daughter, who will graduate next year from high school.  She wants to support her so that she continues with her university studies.

loans.use: to purchase basic staple foods to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Beatrice will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. Beatrice plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Beatrice’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilian, de 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos se encuentran en el extranjero y dos están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, ella estudio hasta tercer grado, el motivo por el cual ya no continuo cursando sus estudios, fue porque se terminaron los recursos económicos, desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura y ahora con ayudad de su esposo, se dedican a la siembra de piña y granos básicos.

Lilian, tiene gran experiencia en dichas actividades y se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia, también se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos, con ayuda de una nieta y su hijo menor.

El dinero será utilizado en tres actividades fundamentales para su familia, una parte del dinero será para comprar insumos agrícola, otra parta será para reparar el techo de su casa y para invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de perfumes para dama y caballero, de esta manera ella mejorara sus ingresos y podrá aportar para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son: tener más terrenos cultivados, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y nietos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando educación básica.
texts.en:
Lilian, age 57, is married with four children. Two are abroad, and two are studying in their community school. She studied until third grade; the reason that she could no longer pursue her studies was that the money ran out, and since then, she has worked in agriculture. Now, with the help of her husband, she grows pineapples and basic grains.

Lilian has considerable experience in these occupations, and they have become the principal source of income for her family. Also, she works as a housekeeper with the help of a granddaughter and her younger son.

The money will be used for three essential activities for her family: one part of the money will be for the purchase of agricultural supplies, another part will be for repairing the roof of their house, and another for investing in a small business selling ladies’ and gentlemen’s perfumes.  In this way, she will improve her income, and be able to contribute to providing for her family’s needs.

The goals that she has for the future are: to have more farmland, and to support her children and grandchildren in their basic education.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, repair the roof of her house, and invest in a small business selling perfumes.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 41-year-old married mother of four children who is sacrificing a lot to satisfy her family's needs. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's university tuition fees. By supporting this loan, you are helping Abir's daughter to build her own successful future. Abir hopes to stay capable of covering her family's needs and expenses.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Getu

texts.en:
Getu is married with four children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy pineapples, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, green bananas and onions. Her business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. 

She aspires to get a permanent business premise. She resides in the family house which has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, green bananas and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ndoffe's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 membres faisant partie d'un Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 20 avril 2010. Elles font principalement du commerce.
ASTOU a droite de la photo et levant la main est âge de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère deux filles.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter de l’oseille à dans les villages environnants qu’elle revend dans la capital. 
Les bénéfices produits par son commerce serviront à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et aussi à épargner dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en: This group of two members is part of a Banc Villageois (Villagers' Bank) which was created on April 20th, 2010.  They are primarily involved in trade.  Astou, on the left of the photo raising her hand, is 50 years old.  She is married and the mother of two girls.  With this loan she will buy sorrel in the surrounding villages to resell in the capital.  The earnings from her business will go towards the education of her children and also towards her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sorrel

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marife is 40 years old her three children are still in school.

Marife has a farming fruit business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marife has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Joy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing to sell.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 52 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child is still in school. Leonila is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Leonila has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 45 años de edad, se dedica a alquilar maquinas lavadoras y también genera ingresos vendiendo mercancías variadas. Hace 5 años, inició su propio generador de ingresos, atendiendo la tradición familiar trasmitida a través de la experiencia de su hermana, quien también se dedica a lo mismo.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado, trabajando diariamente de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, ofreciendo el servicio entre sus vecinos y referidos, quienes se han convertido en su mayor clientela. En la actualidad planea repotenciar sus maquinarias, para mejorar el servicio y lograr educar a sus hijos con mucha calidad.  Para promover sus ventas Sonia utiliza ideas publicitarias que ella ha creado con avisos y a través de sus clientes actuales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tres lavadoras, con esta inversión mejorará su equipo de trabajo y con ello impactará el incremento de sus ventas como es su propósito.
texts.en: Sonia is 45 years old. She rents washing machines as well as sells diverse merchandise. She began this trade five years ago, following her family tradition through her sister's experience, who also works in the same field. Her sales are made on a cash basis, she works daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m, offering her services to her neighbors and other referrals, who have become her major clients. Currently, she is planning to revamp her equipment, to improve the service, and to be able to educate her children with more quality. To promote her business, Sonia uses advertising ideas which she has created with signs and through her current clients. She is now applying to a credikiva, her first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will buy 3 washing machines, and will improve her work equipment as well as increase her sales, as it is her objective.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines.

loans.name: Liliam Marina

texts.es:
Liliam, de 30 años de edad, está soltera, no tiene hijos, estudia los fines de semana y se dedica a trabajar en una zapatería los días de semana.- Ella es  una joven emprendedora, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, como negocio propio, vive con sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura y son ellos los que se han encargado de darle la oportunidad de estudiar y de inculcarle principios morales.

Liliam, tiene 3 años de experiencia de trabajar como empleada en una zapatería y un año de experiencia en venta de productos de belleza, su tía le enseño ese trabajo, porque tambien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería. 

El dinero será utilizado para la compra de perfumería, productos de belleza y ropa para damas y caballeros, porque ha decidido independizarse y comenzar a establecer su propio negocio, el cual será administrado por sí misma, de esta manera podrá obtener las ganancias que le ayudaran a satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

El sueño de Liliam, tener un bazar y una sala de belleza y también quiere estudiar cosmetología para prestar sus servicios en su propia sala de belleza.
texts.en:
Liliam, 30, is single and doesn't have any children. She studies on the weekends and works at a shoe store during the week. She is an enterprising young woman. She also sells beauty products by catalog as her own business. She lives with her parents who work in agriculture. It is them who are responsible for giving her the opportunity to study and for instilling moral principles in her.

Liliam has 3 years of experience working as an employee of a shoe store and 1 year of experience selling beauty products. Her aunt taught her this job because she also sells cosmetics and perfume.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, beauty products, and clothing for men and women because she has decided to become independent and start her own business, which she will run. In this way, she will generate profits that will help her meet her family's needs.

Liliam's dream is to have a bazaar and a beauty salon. She also wants to study cosmetology in order to offer her services at her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy perfume, beauty products, and clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Norlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Norlie works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Norlie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  buy more vegetable to sell like eggplant, cabbage, carrot, etc for her vegetable vending business.

Norlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell like eggplant, cabbages, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a smallholder farmer from a very remote village in the Iten area of Kenya called Mutei. She owns a 3 acre piece of land where she lives with her husband of 15 years and 4 children. 

Loice has 3 dairy cows, 20 heads of poultry, and over 200 trees on her farmland. With all these activities, she still has room left to plant crops. The main problem that she is facing is lack of enough capital to venture into horticultural farming. 

Loice is counting on Kiva lenders to invest in her agri-business expansion in the form of a loan. She will spend the money to pay for farm inputs and implements. Income dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until crops are mature for yielding. The harvest at the end of the season will provide her with food for her family and money for reinvesting into the business.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 28 years old and a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Daisy has a business selling spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Daisy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of spices to sell in her food stall.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices

loans.name: Lumnbani Group

texts.en:
Elise is 30 years old and a mother of one child. She grows and sells mushrooms to people surrounding her community. She started running this business in order to reduce the level of poverty of her household.

She will use the loan to buy mushroom seeds, plastic and other necessities for the growth of mushrooms. She plans to send her child to school and hopes to further improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase mushroom seeds.

loans.name: Savoeng

texts.en:
Savoeng is a 55-year-old mother of three children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost thirty-five years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth micro loan for Savoeng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 18 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her major challenges includes seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from village to the market for sale. 

She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, adicional a eso también se dedica a trabajar como jornal, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pesticidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores cosechas para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated, because he is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, works growing corn and sorghum. In addition, he also works as a day laborer. He has been doing this work for 15 years. He sells his products in the areas near where he lives, and with what he earns, he manages to get ahead. The young man lives in his own house with his family and is asking for a loan to purchase pesticides, fertilizer, manure, herbicide, etc. and in this way be able to improve his harvests for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizer, manure, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Rwambano Group

texts.en:
HAPPNES, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been running a genge duka business for three years now.  She works from 06am to 10pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be HAPPNES's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables for her genge business.  She dreams of expanding her business.

HAPPNES will share this loan with her loan group, "RWAMBANO", which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables for her genge business.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with three children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

She sells airtime, SIM cards, chargers, and batteries in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last five years. She gets additional income from selling newspapers. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy airtime packs of all networks. Her major challenge includes power shortages which interrupt network. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy airtime packs of all networks

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie engages in farming. She toils the land and grows rice. She is a 29-year-old married woman with three dependents, ages 9, 7 and 4 years old. Together with her family, she lives in Getafe, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. This will improve the yield of her farm, and enable her to sell more sacks of rice. Her income will augment and start to manage her finances. She could now pay to settle her obligations and balance her earnings. She could now attend to the needs of her growing children, including a quality education and better shelter to live in.

Analie hopes that her current source of income will expand and be able to uplift the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Daisy is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Daisy has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Daisy has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 59 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a personal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal items.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria comercializa mercancía variada de acuerdo a cada temporada; ella cuando llega  la fiesta del Carnaval de Barranquilla, la felicidad y la alegría no caben en su cuerpo, porque además de disfrutarla, bailar, asistir a la batalla de flores, la guacherna, desfile de los niños, entre otras actividades  se divierte con un verdadero derroche de alegría que emana de su vecindad  y logra vender muchos gorros, disfraces, accesorios, alusivos al carnaval, desde que finaliza el año hasta que llegan los 4 días más relajados que tiene la feliz  ciudad  de Barranquilla. Su preparación comienza desde que finaliza el año, pues inicia el pre carnaval y con él, los picos altos de sus ventas.
