Maria inició su negocio en el año 1990, como consecuencia de una crítica situación económica, pues su cónyuge había quedado desempleado y un familiar atento a apoyarlos, le prestó una pequeña suma de dinero, con la que inició su negocio de venta de mercancías variada, al cual agregó su vinculación a empresas multinacionales, que le facilitaron la oferta de diversos productos mediante catálogos, tal como hoy lo hace.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito entre familiares, amigos, vecinos y referidos por su actual clientela,   a quienes les vende diariamente sin fijarse en el horario que requiera cada comprador, pues es firme en el servicio al cliente y esto la ayuda a crecer gradualmente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues tiene el desafío de lograr un suficiente capital de trabajo para comprar  máscaras, sombreros, collares, gorros, flautas, y accesorios alusivos a la fiesta más esperada por los su clientela, con la que Maria incrementa anualmente sus ventas, para hacer que su negocio genere mayores posibilidades de ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria sells a variety of merchandise depending on the season. For her when the party that is the Barranquila carnival arrives her body can't contain it's happiness and joy. Besides enjoying, dancing, participating in the Battle of Flowers, the Gauchema, the children's parade amongst other activities. She enjoys the absolute burst of joy that emanates from her neighborhood and she manages to sell lots of hats, disguises, and accessories related to the carnival from the end of the year until the 4 most relaxed days that the joyful city of Barranquilla has.

Her preparations begin at the year end as pre-carnival begins and with it her high point of sales. Maria started her business in 1990 as result of a severe economic crisis as her husband was left unemployed. A family member was ready to support them and loaned her a small amount of money with which she started her business selling assorted merchandise. She joined up with multinational companies which expedited her offering of diverse products through catalogs which she still does today.

She makes her sales in cash and on credit with family, friends, neighbors and people refereed by her clients. She sells daily without regard to the time demands of each buyer. She is strong on service to the client and this has helped her grow gradually.

Currently she is requesting a loan from Kiva, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She needs to have sufficient capital to buy masks, hats, collars, caps, flutes and carnival related accessories most in demand by her customers. With this Maria will increase her yearly sales to allow her business to generate greater income possibilities.

loans.use: to buy masks, hats, collars, caps, flutes and accessories related to carnival.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman and is staying together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past nine years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell.

She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman, staying together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling firewood. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood to sell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, manifiesta que el impacto de la inversión del crédito anterior en su negocio le ha permitido tener una mejoría en sus ingresos y compartir con su familia un nuevo estilo de vida.
Sigue produciendo granos básicos y practicando la crianza de ganado y cerdos, pero está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar un molino nixtamal, con el que tendrá un nuevo rubro para generar más ingresos, espera brindar un servicio de calidad y tener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
María says that the impact of the previous loan investment in her business permitted her to have an increase in her income and share a new life style with her family.

She continues growing basic grains and raising livestock and pigs, but she is asking for another loan to purchase a corn mill, with which she will have a new way to earn more income, hoping to offer a quality service and have new customers.

loans.use: to purchase a corn mill, with which she will have a new way to generate more income.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is aged 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She and her husband have been farming rice for two years to make a living. The current business earns her family about 20,000KHR per day to feed the family. 

This is the third loan for Phalla with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Khatoon

texts.en:
Khatoon is a 48-year-old, hardworking widow woman who has two children; one of her son is also shown in the photo. For the last three years, she has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Khatoon’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Currently, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. 

She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a las ventas inicio con capital propia, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija de un año, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas pan dulce por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated on account of him being 20 years old and living in a high risk area, works selling sweet bread.  He sells his bread from a cart around different towns.  He has worked selling bread for about three years, and he started his business using his own money.  He lives with his spouse and their 1 year old daughter in a house that they own.

He is seeking a loan to purchase more sweet bread in bulk so that he can continue working since this is his only source of income and it will allow him to have more financial stability.

loans.use: purchase more sweet bread in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, adicional a eso también vende ropa, posee 8 años de experiencia e inicio con capital propia, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasión para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old and lives with her family in a house that they own.  She works as a farmer, growing corn, but she also sells clothing.  She has eight years of experience working as a farmer, and she started using her own capital.  When her crops are ready to harvest, she stores them in barns so that she can later sell them.  With her earnings, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc. so that she can continue with her farming so she can improve her earnings.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, maize seeds, to cultivate land and pay for the laborers.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, es casada, tiene tres hijos y todos comparten la misma vivienda, tiene una venta de tortillas desde hace 42 años, trabaja de 5:00 am. a 6:00 pm., lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y ha sido una fuente de ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia.
Está necesitando de un crédito para comprar leña, madera y láminas, de esa manera tendrá parte de la materia prima para elaborar las tortillas así como también un lugar más seguro y cómodo para trabajar, le ayudara a atender mejor a sus clientes.
Para Juana es importante mantenerse trabajando para lograr cancelar sus deudas, seguir apoyando a su familia y reconstruir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is married and has three children who share the same living space. She has been selling tortillas for 42 years and works from 5 am to 6 pm. She learned this skill on her own initiative and it has been a source of income to help her husband with family expenses. She needs a loan to buy fire wood, lumber and sheet metal. With these, she will have part of the raw materials that she needs to make her tortillas and, as well, have a more secure and comfortable place to work. This will help her serve her clients better. 

For Juana, it is important to keep on working to be able to pay her bills, continue supporting her family. and to make changes to her house.

loans.use: to buy fire wood, lumber and sheet metal, providing part of the raw material she needs to make tortillas and to create a work space that is more secure and comfortable.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 36-year-old, married father of one child,and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon and their limited work access, he started working in a company as a supervisor six years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family. 

Hasan is a hard worker and ambitious man.  Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to start a new transportation business as a second source of income, through buying a pickup truck. This loan will help Hasan increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. He hopes to expand his business more in the future, and to stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to start a new transportation business as a second source of income by buying a pickup truck.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 57-year-old married mother of six children. She opened her grocery shop five years ago to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Zakia is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying hard to develop her business. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her shop to attract more customers.

She hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her shop to attract more customers.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is a seasoned small farmer from Ngeria village, found in the North Rift area of Kenya. The 66-year-old farmer practices mixed farming. Her main source of income is milk.

Tecla is seeking to take a loan to expand her horticultural farm. She is going to use the money to pay for labour, farm supplies and tools for expansion. She will use the money from the dairy to make initial loan repayments as the new investment gains traction. 

The impact of the loan will be felt through a significant increase of yield volume during the harvest. The harvest will bring Tecla's family more food and more income.

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Ernest. Ernest is a small landholder based in Ngechek village, which is up the North Rift area of Kenya. Maize farming and dairy farming are the most popular and lucrative economic activities for people in North Rift. Ernest, 45 years old, is a dairy farmer. Milk and other dairy products are his main source of income. 

Ernest is seeking a loan to venture into horticultural farming. The new venture will marry well into dairy farming, and the combination of the two activities will bring him and his family untold benefits. With your loan, the horticultural farm he will start will complement the existing dairy farm in the following ways: income from dairy will pay for horticultural expenses as crops mature; lumpsum income from crop farming will be rolled back into the business to buy more cows and plant more crops coming season; by-products from crop farming such as maize stalks, cobs and off-coloured grains will be used as dairy feeds; by-products from dairy such as cow dung will be used for biogas generation and manure for planting crops. 

The impact of this investment is sure to have a big impact on Ernest's family's livelihood.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a 35 year old man. He is married to Sophia and they are blessed with two children. He is in the transportation business using his motorcycle (boda boda). He also farms, and has been doing both for the last three years. 

He has applied for a loan of KES. 90,000 (his first loan) from VisionFund Kenya. He will be using the loan to purchase a new motorcycle. 

With the anticipated profits, Zakayo will be able to buy a dairy cow, seedlings and fertilizer; pay school fees; buy food for the family; and repay his loan. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to boost his boda boda business so that he can buy another motorcycle and employ a driver. This will improve his family's livelihood and provide a better education for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, tiene un salón de belleza y venta de cosméticos, vive con su familia integrada por su esposo y una hija, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad y es apoya por su hija, en este momento no representa dificultades para seguir trabajando.
Comprará  labiales, tratamientos para el cabello, mascarillas, tintes, etc., surtirá mejor el negocio para atender cada vez mejor a sus clientes, espera atraer nuevos clientes para incrementar sus ingresos.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande, contar con clientes satisfechos y cancelar todas sus deudas.
texts.en: Martha has a beauty salon and also sells cosmetics.  She lives with her husband and their daughter.  Her business is located in the city market and her daughter helped her.  At this moment, she does not have any problems working.  With the loan she will purchase lipstick, hair products, masks, dyes, etc.  This will allow her to better stock her store so that she can provide better service to her customers.  She hopes to attract more customers and increase her earnings.  Her dreams are to have a larger business, ensure that her customers are satisfied and to pay off her debts.

loans.use: purchase lipstick, hair products, masks, dyes, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

Maureen has operated a fish-selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the perishability of her goods which results in lost profits.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hardworking individual. That is why she was selected to become the group leader. Agnes represents her group of eight farmers in the Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Agnes has been a farmer for 18 years. In order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming supplies, but also a solar light. The light will help reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money. With the profits from this coming season, Agnes is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.5 acres will be planted by Agnes's Group. Among them they will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as purchasing a solar light.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells merchandise such as biscuits, chocolates, candies, condiments, and other goods. She is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a variety store for five years already.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods. These will be a big help for Anabel in a way that her store will be filled again, and she will start to cater to the needs of her customers. In this way, her income will improve, and she will start to handle her finances.

She hopes that she will be able to expand her business to become successful in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 25 years old and a married woman. She sells animals with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

The couple makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. They also sell milk to generate extra income. Rukhsana needs to improve her business to cover more of the household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is a 54-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and represents his group of ten farmers in the Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Benard has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Benard described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to purchase a solar light because he will now be able to have light during the dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Benard’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mohamad Jouma

texts.en:
Mohamad Jouma is a 38-year-old married Syrian father of four children who has been working in his home products shop for nine years to support his family.

Mohamad Jouma is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. He plans to take a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his merchandise with a new collection of home products to satisfy his customers' needs. He hopes to develop his business in the future to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of home products to satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.es:
Santa Catalina tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos de edades 20, 14 y 3 años de edad en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, la compra lo realiza en tiendas mayoristas de su distrito, se dedica a este negocio desde hace tres años contando con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Santa Catalina espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y preferencias lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina is 42 years old. She lives in her own home, which is made of crude materials. She lives with her husband and their three children who are 20, 14, and 3 years old.

They live in a rural zone in the district of Pucara, a community in a sweltering climate. The residents work in farming, sales, and ranching. The zone is located in the province of Jaen, which is in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Santa Catalina makes a living by selling general groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, and other products. She buys them at wholesale stores in her district. She has been doing this for three years, and she has regular customers who give her good personal and professional references.

She has requested a loan to buy a larger variety of products like rice, sugar, noodles, etc. to increase her business' stock. With this loan, Santa Catalina hopes to offer her customers a better variety of products, satisfying their likes and preferences. This will allow her to improve her income and therefore improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of products like rice, sugar, noodles, etc. to increase her business' stock

loans.name: Salamatu Rahman

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Salamatu Rahman.  She is married and has one child aged one year and three months. She has three additional foster dependents who live with her.  

In 2008, Salamatu Rahman established her clothing, cotton textile business.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 3,563,000 every month from this business. 

Salamatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.  Salamatu Rahman has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of ready-made dresses, head covers, blouses etc.  

In the future, Salamatu Rahman plans to continue to reinvest in her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of ready-made dresses, head covers, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 22-year-old woman from the village of Sergoit in North Rift Kenya. At this young age, she already owns a two-acre farm on which she keeps one dairy cow and 20 chickens. She also has a section dedicated to crop cultivation and trees. At the moment, the crop section (in the picture) is ploughed in preparation for planting season.  

Recently, Janet acquired a versatile Indian motorcycle that she uses to transport produce to the market. The motorcycle expanded Janet's market reach. Never in the past was she able to reach so many clients. With the new opportunity, she is planning to expand her farm to fulfill the demand for her produce.
 
Janet is seeking a loan of KES 80,000 to grow more crops. She will spend the money on labour, farm supplies and storage. With your loan, she is going to significantly increase the volume of produce she supplies to the market at the end of the season. This will translate to more income and better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to expand her farm.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, es parte de una familia formada por su esposo y dos hijos en edades de 10 y 15 años, hace mucho tiempo por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, instalo una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, lo hizo con pocos ahorros.
Invertirá en aceite, arroz, bebidas, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico, golosinas, entre otros productos que sean de utilidad para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, tiene la esperanza de atraer nuevos clientes y continuar trabajando para resarcir sus deudas.
Ana anhela tener el negocio más competitivo de la zona y disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Ana is part of a family that includes her husband and two children aged 10 and 15.  Some time ago, due to the need to support her husband with the household expenses, she set up a store selling basic consumer goods with her small savings.

She will invest this loan in cooking oil, rice, drinks, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, snacks, and other products that will satisfy the demands of her customers.  Ana hopes to attract new customers and continue working to pay off her debts.  

Ana wants to have the most competitive business in the neighborhood and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to invest in products for her store

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She is working hard to meet their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

She and her husband have been farmers for some years. They farm different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Saeeda has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old and has ten children. He has been a farmer for ten years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Daniel is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Daniel started working with One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, to gain access to quality training and new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially by being better able to consistently feed his family. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills.

Daniel’s Group will receive farming supplies to plant a total of 10.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will purchase a solar light. This loan will enable the group to purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Blanca Aracely

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer luchadora, ama de casa y agricultora quien es casada y madre de dos hijos quienes aún viven bajo su techo y colaboran en el campo. Su grado de estudio es de primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar por razones económicas las cuales en su familia no le permitían seguir adelante. Su mayor ingreso económico depende del cultivo de café el cual practica desde hace varios años. El producto una vez cosechado y listo para su venta es comercializado en las bodegas de la comunidad y entre los intermediarios que llegan a la misma en busca de un buen producto. Blanca solicita apoyo económico para la compra de fertilizantes agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café comprando lo necesario para evitar que su plantación sea afectada por alguna enfermedad o plagas ya que está floreciendo y es necesario dar asistirla. Sus metas a corto plazo la limpieza de su propiedad de café, el mantenimiento de las mismas al momento de abonarlas y fertilizarlas para que cuando cosechen lo hagan en abundancia. Como madre de familia fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos, apoyarlos en sus metas, estudios y demás necesidades que tengan para triunfar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Blanca is a determined woman, a housewife and farmer who is married and the mother of two children who still live under her roof and who help in the farm. Her degree of education is limited. She did not complete primary school; for economic reasons in her family she was not allowed to continue her education.

Her major source of income depends on the cultivation of coffee, which she has been doing for several years. Once the coffee has been harvested and ready for sale, it is sold in the warehouses of the community to intermediaries that come to look for a good quality product.

Blanca is asking for economic aid for the purchase of agricultural fertilizers to help her coffee plants, and to buy the necessary products to keep her coffee field from being affected by a disease or an infestation that is spreading; it is necessary to take steps to protect her field. 

Her short term goals are the cleanup of her coffee field, and the maintenance of the same, fertilizing it so that when they harvest the next time, the field will produce abundantly. As a mother, she seeks to increase her children’s inheritance, support them in their goals, education and other necessities that they will have so that they will succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and spray to use on her coffee plants to control disease and pests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure and fertilizers) to support her coffee plants

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Korotoumou est celle assise sur la chaise avec des vêtements prêt à porter sur les jambes. 
Korotoumou âgée de 36 ans, est une commerçante de  vêtements prêt à porter , elle a  8 ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Veuve et mère de 2 enfants, âgés de 18 ans et 15 ans  tous deux scolarisés, korotoumou est une femme dévouée et engagée, prête à se battre pour aider ses enfants. Korotoumou veut faire  mieux avec les bénéfices qu’elle aura avec les fonds reçus de la caisse ce qui lui permettra de mieux prendre soin de ses enfants et d’améliorer  leur condition de vie. Elle achète ses marchandises en gros au grand marché de la capitale pour les revendre aux différents marchés locaux de sa commune ce qui lui permet d’avoir plus bénéfice  lors des ventes.Malgrés quelques problèmes liés à certains clients qui achètent  ses marchandises à crédit et qui prennent beaucoup de temps pour payer, Korotoumou se sent très a laise dans son commerce car elle en tire un bénéfice très élevé.
texts.en:
Korotoumou is the borrower who is sitting on a chair with some ready-to-wear clothes on her lap.  She is 36 years old and she sells ready-to-wear clothes.  She has eight years of experience in this field.  Korotoumou is widowed and the mother of two children, ages 18 and 15.  Both her children go to school.  Korotoumou is a devoted and active woman, eager to do anything she can to help her children.

Korotoumou wants to improve her business with the profits that she will be making thanks to the money received from the RMCR.  Her goal is to take better care of her children and to improve their living conditions.  Korotoumou buys clothing in bulk quantities at the grand market of the capital city, and then resells her merchandise at various local markets in her commune, which allows her to make good profits at resale.  In spite of a few problems with some customers who buy clothes on credit and then take a long time to pay her back, Korotoumou feels very happy with her business because it allows her to make good profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alladin

texts.en:
Alladin is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two sons. They live in the Füzuli region. His eldest son is a taxi driver in the same village; his youngest son learns at university. 

Already for 22 years they have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli City. 

Alladin has been engaged in sheep-breeding on their homestead for many years. Alladin and his wife prepare dairy products such as milk, cheese, yogurt, etc. After this, he sells these products in the local bazaar to earn money. Also he periodically sells sheep wool. 

Today Alladin needs 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat); for this reason he applied to Kiva's partner Komak for a loan. He planning to purchase hay for his sheep, and vaccinations for them, etc. 

He thankful to Kiva and Komak for their help. In the future, he wants to help his son to buy a new house and get married.

loans.use: to buy hay and vaccinations for his sheep

loans.name: Sanamhon

texts.en:
Sanamhon has twenty years' experience as a seamstress who sews traditional women's dresses. She has liked to sew since childhood. She has three children--raising them alone is hard for her. 

Sanamhon studied medicine, but does not work in this field. Because she lives in a rural area, there is no chance to do this kind of work. Sometimes she serves as a nurse for her neighbors and other locals. 

Basically her activity is sewing traditional women's dresses. She lives in bad conditions. Her monthly income is spent only on family expenses. She wants to have better conditions. 

She requests financial support from Kiva lenders to buy construction supplies like cement, plaster, adhesive and wallpaper to renovate her house. She asks for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to fix her house.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose earns a living by fishing. She is a 20-year-old woman with a one-year-old son. She catches fresh fish and sells it to the local residents in her community. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing net. This will help her improve her regular catch so she can sell more fish and improve her life. She will be able to pay her dues and provide her child with nutritious meals. 

In the future, she dreams to expand her current business to make it sustainable and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of his vehicle, as well as to buy accessories for it

loans.name: Cjfdt 26 Group

texts.fr: CJFDT est un sous groupe de la Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 07 personnes dont des hommes et des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et pratiquent les mêmes activités. Fatimata est la présidente de ce sous groupe, on la reconnait par la main levée sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans l'élevage des bœufs. Elle a une expérience de plus de 12 ans et sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son cheptel et diversifier sa production. Elle voudrait acheter des bœufs de race qui viennent d'Europe. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle souhaite à l'avenir créer une ferme et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra épargner de l'argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
CJFDT is a sub-group of the Association "Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette".  It comprises seven members, men and women who live in the same village and are involved in the same activities.  Fatimata is the president of this sub-group.  In the photo, she is the borrower raising her hand.

Fatimata is a wife and mother.  She makes a living raising oxen.  She has more than 12 years of experience in this field.  She is taking a loan to increase the size of her herd and diversify her production.  She would like to buy oxen of a European breed.

Fatimata helps her husband to take care of the family's daily expenses and the children's school fees.  She works from 8 AM until 6 PM.  In the future, she would like to create a farm and increase her income as this would allow her to save some money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oxen to raise and resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman who has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability of her goods, leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Denis's Group

texts.en:
Denis is 33 years old and often described as a very resourceful person. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Denis represents his group of 12 farmers in the Webuye District of Kenya. He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Denis's desire to have access to quality training and new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming supplies, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan. This is very exciting for him as he will now be able to have light during the dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Denis and his group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lolok

texts.en:
Lolok is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in in a wooden pile house with her parents and her younger brother. Her family owns 7 hectares of rice fields, 1.5 hectares of cassava fields and 8 pigs. In 2013, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Lolok weaves scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal food, fertilizer and diesel for the field.  Most importantly, she wants to make her family business grow thanks to her salary. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 9 farmers in Webuye District. She is 42 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Gladys likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Gladys plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Gladys’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Victor's Group

texts.en:
Victor is 20 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. As a group leader, Victor is representing his group of 12 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya. He is excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Victor's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan. This is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Victor and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans to buy maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as to buy a solar light.

loans.name: Ramza

texts.en:
Ramza is a 39-year-old married mother of four children who runs a business renting wedding and special occasion dresses from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Ramza is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of wedding and engagement dresses, which will help her satisfy her customers' needs.

Ramza hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of wedding and engagement dresses

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir is married, 28 years old and has a child. His daughter goes to third class. Narmin is Mahir’s wife, and she is a teacher in school. Mahir's family is IDP (internally displacted persons) from Fuzuli city already 22 years. Now they live in the Fuzuli region. Mahir is a taxi driver; he transported passengers between different areas of the Fuzuli region. Now Mahir wants to repair his car. He wants to buy a new motor for his car and increase his monthly income. For this reason he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful to Kiva and the Komak organization for the help. In the future he wants to paint his car.

loans.use: to buy new motor for his car and increase his monthly income. In the future he wants to paint his car.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 20-year-old single lady from Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father is a worker who earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. Nahed is a student who studies ِbusiness administration. She would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Nahed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to cover part of the urgent expenses she has.

Nahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children who all go to school. She has no additional household members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.

Teddy sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis, working seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

Teddy's major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 15 y 6 años y una hija mujer de 1 año, y su negocio venta de edredones y ropa de cama.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, emprendedora, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Tilata’  que se caracteriza por abastecer con 32 pozos de agua subterránea a la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura ambiente entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Lidia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún es un bebé, viven en una casa propia construido de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama, como; edredones, cubrecamas, sábanas y almohadas, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, visitando ferias, comercios y mercados todos los días de la semana por la mañana y por la tarde. “inicie mi actividad porque vi la necesidad de los clientes que buscaban ropa de cama, y que nadie vendía…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mercadería que vende es por temporada y la desventaja es que no cuenta con puesto fijo de venta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa de cama, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de variedad de ropa de cama, como; sábanas´, edredones, almohadones, etc., para aumentar sus ingresos y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de cama para ofertar mayor variedad y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 34-year-old married woman. She has two sons who are 15 and 16 and a daughter who is 1. She has a business selling quilts and bedding.

She is a good mother, patient, enterprising, understanding, responsible, and hard-working. She works in the Tilata zone, which is known for providing 32 wells of underground water to the city. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature between 0 and 12 degrees Celcius.

Lidia is short, tanned, of sturdy stature, and has black, braided hair and brown eyes. She dresses traditionally (hat, cloak, and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she uses with her family, and she speaks Spanish in everyday life and through her business.

She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and her children. The two older ones are in school, and the little one is still a baby. They live in their own brick and cement house, which has running water, electricity, and plumbing.

She sells bedclothes for a living, such as quilts, bedspreads, sheets, and pillows. She is a traveling saleswoman, visiting fairs, shops, and markets every day of the week, in the morning and the afternoon. "I started my job because I saw the needs of the clients who were looking for bedclothes but nobody sold them..." she says. Her business' advantage is that the merchandise she sells is seasonal, and the disadvantage is that she doesn't have an established location to sell from.

Her dream is to have a bedding store. She wants to grow her business by buying a variety of bedclothes such as sheets, quilts, pillows, etc. She would be able to increase her income and send her children to school. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has had this independent business.

For these reasons, Lidia is requesting a loan to buy bedclothes to offer better variety and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy bedclothes to offer better variety and send her children to school

loans.name: Teresa Lily

texts.es: Teresa es madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales dos asisten al colegio de su comunidad los fines de semana, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario inicio su negocio hace cinco años cuando la indeminizaron de su empleo, y tomo la decisión de tener un trabajo propio, ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la venta de artículos(productos comestibles) tales como frijol arroz, fideo, jabón, etc.  ya que actualmente las ventas han subido y no cuenta con el capital para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is the single mother of three children, two of whom attend their community high school on the weekends.

She makes a living by selling everyday products. She started her business five years ago when she received compensation from her employer, and she decided to start her own business.

She is requesting a loan to invest in selling products (groceries) such as beans, rice, noodles, soap, etc. because sales have been increasing recently and she doesn't have the capital to invest in the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is a 53-year-old married man with three children. His youngest child is 12. Artemio runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities like chips, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries. In addition to that, he also engages in fresh fish vending business.

He is asking to buy supplies for the store like canned goods, vegetables and bread. These will help improve the stocks of his store and attract potential customers. In these way, his income will grow and he will be able to handle his finances. He could now continue send his children to school and cater to their respective needs.

He is determined to expand his business to become more successful and sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store like canned goods, vegetables and bread.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 33 years old and a married woman.

Eva is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 50 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Adelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her cows.

Adelina has been raising cows for nine years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her cows.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking time to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a 64-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Catherine has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Catherine described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Catherine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, hence perishability of goods leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata is a 45-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Consolata has noticed that she has gained a lot of respect in her community.

Consolata described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Consolata’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Clara's Group

texts.en:
Clara's Group is formed of nine farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Clara, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 38 years old, is married, and has three children. Clara has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Clara isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Clara will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition because she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Using this loan, Clara's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession; he sells vegetables such as potato, lady fingers, and corn flower. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Naseem's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not able to purchase vegetables for his business.

Therefore Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en:
Madiha is a 25-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a simple housewife. Her husband has been running a movie-making business for the past 18 years. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the overall household. Madiha's husband needs to buy different types of items, e.g. camera, wires, video cassettes for movie making. Due to insufficient financial resources he is not in a position to buy these items to fulfill his needs. Therefore Madiha has planned to help her husband by requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can buy all of the above items relevant to his business and enable himself to earn maximum profitable income by providing better services.
For this financial assistance Madiha is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's movie-making business

loans.name: Essoham

texts.fr: Essoham est une femme veuve âgée de 41 ans. Essoham vit avec trois enfants à sa charge et habite dans le quartier d’Agoè. Essoham désire contribuer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants en vendant des ustensiles de cuisine. Ce commerce lui génère un gain favorable pour subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Essoham s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des plats et des casseroles, Essoham sollicite ce crédit pour son financement et gagner une bonne rentabilité
texts.en: Essoham is a 41-year-old widow.  She lives with her three dependent children in the Agoè neighborhood.  She sells kitchen utensils in order to actively contribute to her children's well-being.  This business allows her to make money and meet her daily expenses.  Essoham stocks up at the market three times per month.  She is taking this loan to buy some serving dishes and sauce pans.  This loan will help her to finance her activity and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy 30 serving dishes and 9 dozen sauce-pans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Dodaroi

texts.en: Dodaroi was born and grew up in the rural area of Amondara. She has had a dream to be a doctor from childhood. She did not have an opportunity to enter the university because the only medical university is situated in the capital of Tajikistan. Dodaroi does not have enough money to pay tuition fees and rent an apartment. But she found another chance to study nearby. She entered a medical college in her area. She studies to be a nurse and wants to work at a medical clinic in Amondara. She decided with her parents to ask for a loan from KIVA lenders to pay her college tuition fees. Dodaroi hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for college.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: There are a lot of divorced women in Tajikistan for the last time. Unfortunately, Mahina is one of those divorced women. She was born in the family of workers in 1984. She has three children and it is not easy to raise them. She participated at startup training which was provided by IMON. She has practice and wants to open a new business at a shopping network in the centre of city. She has an idea of trading stationery products. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 TJS to open a new business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy stationery products

loans.name: Xalig

texts.en: Xalig is a taxi driver, he is 42 years old. He is married with two children. His elder child is in second year at University and his younger son is in fourth grade at school. Xalig’s wife, Minaya, is a housewife. They live in the Fuzuli region but have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city for 22 years. Xalig has applied for a loan of 1100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car. He has been in this business for 15 years and his car is outdated. His car was damaged and therefore he can’t work. He hasn’t worked for a while and cannot support his family. To restore his monthly income, the car needs to be repaired. He believes that if his car is repaired, his situation will be good enough, as before, and he will be able to support his family. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the help. In the future he wants to help his children in education.

loans.use: to repair his car and restore his monthly income

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her candle-making business. Lilia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, rice, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide a secure life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, rice, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zawadi operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different types of hair products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ellen is 36 years old and both of her children are in school.

Ellen has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Ellen requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Ellen has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ellen would like to save money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Agé de 29 ans,  Kossi est un homme marié très actif qui vit dans le quartier d’Agoè. Kossi a cinq enfants et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier. Cette activité lui procure un bénéfice qui couvrir les charges de la famille. Kossi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché local. Pour  équiper son étagère, Kossi demande ce crédit pour commander des tomates, des détergents et des sacs de riz pour réaliser un bon profit et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en: Kossi is a 29-year old married man who is very resourceful. He lives in the Agoè neighborhood. He has five children and sells general food products locally. The revenue from this business allows him to provide for his family. Kossi stocks up four times a month at the local market. In order to restock his stand, Kossi is applying for this loan to buy tomatoes, detergents and bag of rice to make a good profit and provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of tomatoes, four boxes of detergent and two bags of rice.

loans.name: Azima

texts.fr: Agée de 62 ans, Azima est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Azima vit à Agoè et est une revendeuse de bouillie  préparée à base du mil dans le quartier. Ce commerce lui permet de venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire. Azima s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander du mil et des bols de sucre, Azima demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficicaire.
texts.en: Azima is 62 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives in Agoè and makes a living selling a type of gruel prepared with millet, in her neighborhood.  Thanks to this activity, she is able to help meet her family's needs while making a good profit margin.  She goes to the market four times per month to buy supplies.  Azima is requesting this loan to buy millet and sugar.  This loan will help her to meet her goals and make a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy one bag of millet and five bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 21 years-old single man from Jenin city who lives with his family in a small house. His father works as a taxi driver where he receives a low and unstable income. 

Haytham is a university student studying information technology. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a job.

Haytham took a loan from FATEN to pay the university fees for this semester. This loan will help him cover part of his expenses.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 26-year-old single man from Jenin City. He lives with his family in a small house. His father has a small workshop for recycling plastic. Ibrahim is a university student, where he studies finance. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to cover part of the urgent expenses he has.

Ibrahim appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa is 67 years old and married with 10 children. Hermosa works very hard to provide for them.

Hermosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hermosa has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Hermosa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods purchased on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shamim is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Albert's Group

texts.en:
Albert is a 60 year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual. Heis representing his group of seven farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Albert has been able to consistently feed his family.

Albert described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Albert's Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase six solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 55 years old woman who she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has worked in a public sector organization for many years. Nasreen is also provides sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her household income.
 
Nasreen is in need of different kinds of goods, like needles, threads, clothes and machine oil for her business, But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable Nasreen to purchase sewing accessories and increase her monthly sales and profits.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, threads, clothes and machine oil for her sewing business.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their family. Shumaila also works, providing sewing services and earning income so she can contribute with her husband towards managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc, for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories, and will also be helpful in increasing her monthly sales and profit by allowing her to provide better sewing services.

Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Noor Eddin

texts.en:
Noor Eddin is a 24-years-old single man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as a Circus trainer. Noor is also a university student where he studies Business administration. he would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Noor took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to cover part of the urgent expenses he has. Noor appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Meneth

texts.en:
Meneth is 44 years old, married and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Meneth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Meneth requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Meneth has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meneth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 37-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Jane has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Jane described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a food kiosk for the past two years, selling household consumables like rice, beans, and chapati. She faces a major challenge of creditors for goods taken on credit giving her a hard time.

With the loan, she wants to purchase plastic chairs and tables to use in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs  and tables

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a smallholder livestock farmer based in the Iten region of Kenya. He owns a lush four-acre piece of farmland where he stays with his lovely wife whom he married four years ago. He and his wife don't have any kids yet. He rears 4 dairy cows and 20 heads of poultry. 

Stephen is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to diversify activities on his farm. With your loan, he plans to transform his farm into a mixed-farm by introducing crop farming.

Your loan will impact Stephen's family through integration of crop farming and livestock farming, which will result in a well-balanced productive system. The complementary relationship between crop farming and livestock farming will enable the family to save money (by utilizing by-products) and make more money (by selling main products).

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family, responsible to fulfill the needs of all of the family members. Shazia has been running her own beauty salon for the past four years. She also contributes her income along with her husband's to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hairbrush, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes. Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for five years. Her husband is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Shehnaz's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purpose. Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more a profitable income. Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to send her children to school and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.
