With the help of this loan, Robina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn more profitable income. Robina also plans to increase her savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Robina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Mourice is 30 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Mourice is representing his group of 14 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Mourice's desire to make more farmer friends in his community. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to rent more land to cultivate in.

Mourice and his group will receive a total of 7 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 38 year old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 18 years. Her husband alone is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Robina's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business. Therefore Robina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

On this financial assistance Robina is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as a farmer on his agricultural land. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a university student where he studies Business administration. He would like to take a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay his university installments for this semester. This will help him to cover part of the urgent expenses he has.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay his university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 70 years old and a widowed mother of five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Conchita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Conchita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Conchita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Honner

texts.en:
Honner is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 54 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Belen has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Belen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.
Belen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Belen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband has owned a barber shop for the past three years. Her husband is the guardian of family and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of the family members. 

Her husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hairbrush, blades and other accessories for his barber shop. Due to financial constraints, her husband is not capable of buying these items for his business purposes. Therefore Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for his business purposes so that he can provide better services to his customers. It will also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family. Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her husband's barber business

loans.name: Soknao

texts.en: Soknao is a 28-year-old single factory worker who is from Kandal province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory in a nearby province since 2011, earning approximately USD 4.80 a day. She is also pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting and finance at a university in the city. She works in the factory from Monday to Friday and she goes to the university in the city from Saturday to Sunday. Soknao is lacking the finances to cover her university fees for a year and a semester. Therefore, she would like to request a loan. She will earn a Bachelor’s degree successfully with this loan. For her dreams, Soknao wants to work in a microfinance institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to help improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to cover her university fees for a year and a semester

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness is single with two children, both of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members. She has been operating a beauty salon for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, shampoo, weaves, hair relaxers and treatments. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include power shortages. She would like to get better equipment such as dryers and seats so as to attract more customers. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy braids, shampoo, weaves and hair relaxers

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of nine children, Tita works hard to support her family.  She operates a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice.

Tita is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Maimuna has operated a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la confección de polleras.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, amable, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ovejuyo, un área residencial situada al sur de la ciudad, donde antiguamente se criaban las ovejas para ser ofertadas en la ciudad, actualmente ya es parte de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 9-18 grados centígrados.
Eva es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con su hijo pequeño, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la confección de polleras; estás son faldas externas del vestido femenino, las personas que lo usan son tradicionales. Se confeccionan de diferentes materiales como; algodón o lana y suelen llevar adorno coloridos en diferentes técnicas, como; bordados y encajes con diferentes diseños. “actualmente las polleras se están confeccionando como las de hace 15 años, tendrán más bastas (pliegues horizontales), pero más pequeñas…” comenta. Su sueño es incrementar su producción y contratar bordadores, ella desea realizar la compra de cortes de tela para confeccionar polleras. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela para incrementar su producción y confeccionar polleras.
texts.en: Eva is a 27 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has a 2 year old boy and works making polleras (traditional skirts.) She is a good mother, independent, entrepreneurial, kind, with a good attitude, responsible, and hard working. She works in the Ovejuyo zone, a residential area located in the southern part of the city where, in ancient times, people raised sheep to sell in the city. Currently this area is part of the city, with a cold and dry climate, and a temperature fluctuating between 9-18 degrees Celsius. Eva has a dark complexion, long, black, tied up hair, dark eyes, short stature, robust built. Her native tongue is Aymara, which she speaks at home and she also speaks Spanish as general knowledge and to do business. She shares her life with her partner who works in commercial trade and her small son. They live in a rented house, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, it has running water and electricity. Her business is to make polleras (traditional skirts.) These are skirts used externally in women's clothing.  The people that wear them wear traditional clothing. They are made of diverse fabrics such as cotton or wool, and they usually have colorful adornments in different styles like embroidery or lace appliques with different designs. "currently polleras are made like the ones made 15 years ago, they have more "bastas" (horizontal folds) but are smaller..." she states. Her dream is to increase her production and to hire embroiderers. She wants to buy different fabrics to make the skirts. This is the first loan with the institution in the year she has been dedicated to this activity. Thus, Eva is requesting a loan to buy fabrics to increase production and make skirts.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to increase her production and manufacture polleras (traditional skirts.)

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad Catimore, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes, deshierbos y pago de mano de obra para la cosecha de su cultivo, con esto Angel espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 50 years old. he lives in his own house with his wife in the district of Querocotillo which is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture and raising cattle and animals.

Angel work growing Catimore varietal coffee. He has 15 years of experience in this business and good references in the district. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor to harvest his crops. Doing this Angel hopes to offer a better product to his clients. This will allow him to increase his income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay for labor to harvest the crop.

loans.name: Dorilyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is married and works hard to support her family.
She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from charcoal sales. Darlyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.
Darlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a married woman and living with her husband and four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 
For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maria Erodita

texts.es:
María vive junto a su esposo e hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad  caracteriza por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones del país, además porque en ella se encuentra la etnia Tsachila.
María y su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras, ella en  su casa cuenta con un pequeño criadero de pollos, al cual le pone mucho empeño ya que es una fuente principal de ingreso para su hogar, ya es conocida en el sector por lo que vienen a comprarle a su domicilio, aunque además ella también recorre por tiendas a vender su producto. Su esposo le da mucho apoyo a su esposa, gracias a su ayuda ella puedo emprender con el negocio hace varios años atrás, actualmente mientras su esposa se dedica a su negocio, él trabaja en una empresa en la misma ciudad.
Se pudo percibir que son una familia muy unida, gracias al esfuerzo en conjunto ellos han podido construir su casa poco a poco, han salido adelante juntos. 
María y su esposo están felices ya que gracias al crédito otorgado por la institución podrán comprar más pollos y su alimento para poder crecer de a poco en su negocio. Con ello en un futuro podrán seguir dándoles la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and children in the city of Santo Domingo de Los Colorados, a city that is known for being the land bridge that links the regions of the country. This place is also where people of Tsáchila ethnicity live.

María and her husband are hardworking people. At her house, she has a small poultry farm that she established with great effort. It serves as the main source of income for her home. María is known in the area for having bought her house. She goes to shops in order to sell her product. Her husband has been very supportive of her. Thanks to his help, María was able to establish her business several years ago. While María manages her business, her husband works at a company in the same city.

One can perceive that María’s family is very close. Thanks to their joint efforts, they have been able to build a house over time so that they could forge ahead together.

María and her husband are pleased to receive the loan from Fundación Alternativa. They will be able to buy more chickens and feed so that they can grow their business a bit more. As a result, they can continue providing an education for their children in the future.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a vigorous, 50-year-old, married lady. The man shown in the photo is her son. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to buy bundles of cloth along with more spools of thread in different colors, zippers, and buttons. With this loan, she hopes to create a means of increasing revenue so she is able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth along with more spools of thread in different colors, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres de 52 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 22 a 27 años. En el año 2011, exactamente en el mes de Abril, un amigo de Andrés le sugirió que comercializará artículos de aseo personal, como jabones, papel higiénico, crema dental, y desde ese momento no se ha detenido. Hoy tiene una clientela que ha construido por sí mismo entre amigos, familiares y referenciados por estos.  Andrés vende directamente visitando a su clientela, organiza su tiempo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días, porque se propone genera mayores utilidades, abrir un local al público y remodelar su vivienda. Así mismo su mayor desafío es comprar en un mayor volumen, para obtener importantes descuentos, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará jabones, papel higiénico, desodorantes, cremas dentales etc. Con esta inversión logrará su propósito haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Andrés is 52 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and their two children, ages 22 and 27. In April 2011, a friend of Andrés convinced him to sell toiletries such as soap, toilet paper, and toothpaste. He continues this business to this day. The clientele that he has built by himself includes friends, relatives, and referrals. Andrés sells directly by visiting his customers. He organizes his time every day between the hours of 7:00 A.M. and 6:00 P.M. because this is when he is able to generate the most profit so that he can open a shop and remodel his home. His greatest challenge is being able to buy in volume so that he can obtain major discounts.

For this reason, Andrés is applying for a Kiva loan. He will use the money to buy soaps, toilet paper, deodorants, toothpastes, and other products. This investment will achieve its purpose, thus making the Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy soaps, toilet paper, deodorants, toothpastes, and other products.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura, inicio con capital propio desde hace 7 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 34-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her two children. She works in agriculture and started seven years ago with her own capital. Beatriz sells her products at different markets that are located near her home. She has many customers and the income she generates from her sales allows her cover some of her household expenses.

Beatriz is requesting a new loan because she wants to buy more seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that she can improve the land shown in the photograph. As a result, she can continue growing her crops so that she can have more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that she can improve her land.

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 74 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 50 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Agnes is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by six farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Agnes started working with One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Agnes’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, T-shirts, boxer shorts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Las Decididas, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 11 años. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Juana realiza el crédito para su esposo, el se dedica a la compra y venta de  chanchos,  él se desplaza hasta los campos a comprar los chanchos en pie y luego los faena en su casa, dos veces por semana vende la carne, huesos, cuero y todo lo que pueda vender de los cerdos a personas y conocidos del lugar, su clientela es abundante ya que ellos ofrecen un buen producto y a un buen precio. 
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos para la venta de la semana.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank named “Las Decididas” meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo. They engage in different business activities in order to improve their quality of life. They work in trade, food sales, and other business activities.

Sra. Juana lives in this place. She is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 20 and 11). Her husband is a bricklayer.

Doña Juana is obtaining a loan for her husband who also buys and sells pigs. He travels to the country to buy live pigs and brings them home to butcher. Twice a week he sells the meat, bones, skin, and any other part of the animal that can be sold. His customers include residents and acquaintances from the area. Her husband’s clientele is large because he offers a good product at a good price.

This loan will be used to buy pigs that can be sold throughout the week. Juana has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and she enjoys the assistance that the organization provides. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher for her husband's business.

loans.name: Eris Alfredo

texts.es: Eris de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto, tiene más de 25 años de experiencia, y esa experiencia la obtuvo gracias a su padre, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 2 novillas para repasto y engorde y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Eris is 46 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife. He earns his living by raising grazing cattle. Eris has more than 25 years of experience, thanks to his father. He sells his products in the neighboring towns and has many customers. With the income he generates, Eris is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy two heifers for grazing and fattening. As a result, he can continue his work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy two heifers for grazing and fattening.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 25-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and one child. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for two years. Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Mehwish's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore Mehwish has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance, Mehwish is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Gibson's Group

texts.en:
Gibson is a 56-year-old proud father of 12 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Gibson has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Gibson described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Gibson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bridgit's Group

texts.en:
Bridgit is a 52-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Bridgit has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Bridgit described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Bridgit’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée de 47 ans qui vit à Agoè avec ses quatre enfants. Akou est une femme très dynamique et entreprenante qui vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans une boutique. Son commerce lui procure le revenu nécessaire pour répondre favorablement aux besoins quotidiens. Akou s’approvisionne  quatre fois par mois marché. Akou demande ce nouveau crédit pour acheter des cartons de spaghetti, des bidons d’huile et des sacs de riz afin de faire plus de bénéfice et répondre aux attentes de ses clients
texts.en: Akou is a married woman, 47 years old, who lives in Agoè with her four children. She is a very energetic and entrepreneurial woman who sells grocery items in a store. Her commerce brings in the revenues necessary to respond favorably to day-to-day needs. She gets her supplies four times a month at the market. Akou is asking for this new loan to purchase boxes of spaghetti, containers of oil, and sacks of rice, so as to make more profit and meet the expectations of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase 4 boxes of spaghetti, 3 containers of oil, and 3 sacks of rice

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans Essi est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec ses deux enfants. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement, Essi vend de l’huile rouge et des tourteaux en se promenant dans son quartier. Ce commerce lui permet de bénéficier d’un revenu pour aider son mari à financer l’éducation de leurs enfants. Essi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour passer une commande de bidons d’huile rouge et des tourteaux, Essi demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire
texts.en: Essi, aged 50, is a married woman who lives in Agoè with her two children. As a very enterprising woman active in development, she sells red oil and tourteaux by going from door to door in her district. This commerce enables her to benefit from an income to help out her husband financing their children’s education. She gets her supplies four times a month at the market. To put in a special order for containers of red oil and some tourteaux, Essi is asking for this loan to reach her goals and to have a good profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase 3 containers of red oil and some tourteaux

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a mother of 4 children who practices diversified farming in Sergoit village in the North Rift area of Kenya. She is married and lives on the farm with her husband of 18 years. She owns 4 acres of land, where she keeps 2 dairy cows, 4 sheep, and 6 head of poultry. 

Jackline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to venture into crop farming and to buy a brood of hens. From the investment in crop farming, she seeks to earn the highest returns on farm business because all byproducts are properly utilized. Plus, having additional hens will increase her chick, egg, and meat supply to the market.

Income from this investment will help her educate her children and provide them with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming and buy poultry

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 26-year-old married woman without children who lives in Rsaifeh. Feeling that her husband was facing financial problems and could not cover all of their household expenses, she decided to help him and started selling blankets, table coverings, and curtains.

Basma has been involved in this business for five months. Her business is located in her home, and her primary customers are regulars. She requested a loan to buy more blankets and products to resell to increase her income. Her plan is to open a shop, and she hopes that in the future she will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and products to resell to increase her income

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 68 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Margaret is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Margaret started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Margaret’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 41-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is the mother of 5 children.  Her husband has been operating a general store for the past five years, and is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.  

Yasmeen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, including rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items for his business.  However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes.  Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  

This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and is also helpful for him to earn maximum profit to manage his household and business.  Yasmeen is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items for her husband's retail business.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Yawavi est une femme mariée de 37ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants. Yawavi vend jus préparé à base du maïs pour gagner son revenu et favoriser une éducation adéquate à ses enfants. Grâce à ce commerce Yawavi arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité. Yawavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local. Afin de préparer son jus et faire plus de vente, Yawavi demande ce prêt pour acheter des bols de maïs et atteindre ses objectifs
texts.en: Yawavi is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her four children. She sells prepared beverages made from corn in order to earn her income and to benefit her children with an adequate education. Thanks to this commerce, Yawavi manages to save some money and derive a good profit from her business. She gets her supplies once a month at the local market. To make her beverages and to sell more, Yawavi is asking for this loan to purchase basins of corn and to reach her goals.

loans.use: to purchase 100 basins of corn

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge, tiene una venta de repuestos para bicicletas, trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 6 años, aprendió a desarrollar el oficio con la ayuda de su familia, atiende a sus clientes de cinco de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, Jorge, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermanos, nadie depende económicamente de él, pero apoya a su familia con los gastos.
Utilizará el capital para comprar rines, llantas, tubos, parches, pedales, etc., incrementara su inventario y brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el objetivo es tener mayores ventas e ingresos con los que cumplirá con sus obligaciones.
Sus sueños son adquirir su casa, seguir  siendo un apoyo para su madre y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Jorge owns a bicycle repair shop; he has been working independently for the last 6 years. He learned this trade with the help of his family, and he serves his customers from five in the morning until four in the afternoon. Jorge is single, he lives with his mother and brothers, and nobody is financially dependent on him, although he helps his family with the household expenses.
He will use the capital to buy rims, tyres, tubes, patches, pedals, etc. This will increase his inventory and he will provide a better service to his customers. The aim is to increase sales and income, which will enable him to fulfill his commitments.
His dreams are to acquire his own home, and to continue to support his mother and have a family of his own.

loans.use: to buy rims, tyres, tubes, patches, pedals, etc. It would increase his inventory and help him provide a better service to his customers.

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
Stella is 35 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. She has 2 children and is married. As a group leader, Stella is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Stella's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she will gain from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Stella and her group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as input loans for maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eva Consuelo

texts.es:
Eva Consuelo tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una comunidad habitada por personas respetuosas y honradas, la cual es una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Eva Consuelo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, cerdos, entre otros, ella cría a su animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Eva solicita préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprando un mayor número de animales como cuyes, patos, gallinas, pavos; para asi tener una variedad más grande que ofrecerle a sus clientes, lo que le va a permitir ser mucho más conocida en el negocio, podrá captar a más a clientes, aumentarán sus ingresos, al igual que sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida tambien mejorará.
texts.en:
Eva Consuelo is 45 years old. She has a partner and a son dependent on her. She lives in her own home in a community where respected and honourable people live, which is a rural area located in the Oyotún district, in the Chiclayo province of the La,bayeque region on the coast of northern Peru. 

Eva Consuelo makes a living breeding and selling farm animals, such as chickens, ducks and pigs, among others. She rears the animals in the back of her home. Eva is asking for a loan to invest in her business, and to buy a higher number of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, chickens and turkeys, in order to have a greater variety to offer her customers. This will allow her to become more well-known in the business, and she will be able to attract more customers, increase her income, as well as her earnings, and ultimately her quality of life will also improve.

loans.use: to invest in her business, by buying a higher number of animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, turkeys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is 21 years old, single and lives in Irbid. He is a student in a university, majoring in hotel management.

Naser has a lot of dreams and plans to achieve after he graduates from the university, but his father cannot help him to cover his education fees. Therefore, Naser asked for an education loan to help him cover his university fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 63-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three sons and six daughters. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for five years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Parveen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Parveen is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Malangalanga Group

texts.en:
Sapulene is 34 years old and married. She sells fritters to people in her community. She started this business in order to find funds for supporting her family by providing them with their needed resources. 

She has six children and four of them go to school while two are married.  She will use the loan to expand her business. She plans to build a better house for her children and hopes to provide her children with food three times a day. 

The profits from the previous loans have helped her to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Filyar

texts.en:
Filyar is a 53-year-old woman. She is living in the Fuzuli region with her lovely family of her husband and three children. Her elder son is going to eleventh class, and in the future, he wants to be a programmer. Another child is going to tenth class, and the little daughter is going to sixth class at school.  

The family members are refuges from Fuzuli city. For over 22 years, they have been living like IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). 

Filyar has been in the poultry business for many years. She raises chickens and sells their eggs and meat. Today, to expand the poultry farm and increase business, she needs a loan in the amount of 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Filyar is very grateful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future, she wants to help her children in education and buy computers for her children.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Yanira Yolanda

texts.es:
Yanira, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace más de 14 años, lo prendió de su madre, sus horarios de trabajo son de 8:00 am. a 2:00 pm., dicha actividad la ha tomado como fuente de ingresos para poder darle el sustento diario a su familia, ella es casada y comparte la vivienda con su esposo y su hijo de 9 años, es una esposa y madre dedicada a buscar el bienestar de su familia.
Comprará maíz, leña, cal y gas propano para mantener la venta de tortillas surtida con la materia prima necesaria, espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio, contar con la satisfacción de sus clientes y tener  nuevas ganancias con las que cambiara el estilo de vida familiar.
Su visión con el crédito es administrarlo de manera adecuada, obtener mejores ganancias y cancelar la deuda obtenida.
texts.en:
Yanira has been making a living preparing and selling stuffed tortillas for more than 14 years. She learned to do so from her mother, and her working hourse are from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm. She has been using this trade as a source of income in order to support family on a daily basis. She is married and shares her home with her husband and her 9 year-old son. She is a dedicated wife and mother, devoted to the well-being of her family.
She will buy corn, wood, limestone and propane gas in order to keep selling tortillas stuffed with the necessary primary materials. She hopes to increase her business' productivity, depend on her customers' satisfaction and earn more, which will change her family's lifestyle.
Her vision with the loan is to use it appropriately, to earn more and to pay back the incurred debt.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, limestone and propane gas to keep selling stuffed tortillas with the necessary primary materials.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher is 34 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Janepher has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family, and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Janepher also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Janepher's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has no children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers buy. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed, animal licks and parasiticides. He hopes this will help him to build a cattle dip, add another dairy cow and repay his loan too.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 30-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and two kids - a son and a daughter - in a small house. Yousef would like to open a cafe in his neighborhood. He will make soft drinks and light sandwiches. It is a good business and provides a good income.

Yousef took out a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy supplies, chairs, and tables for his cafe. By taking out this loan, Yousef will be able to start his business and be independent.

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy supplies, chairs, and tables for his cafe.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Janepher will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. Janepher plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

Janepher’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Phoebe's Group

texts.en:
Phoebe is 42 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Phoebe has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Phoebe also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Phoebe's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына. Назира, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Назира, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 1 лошадь, 20 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га арендованной и 1,80 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель, люцерну, пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и удоя экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nazira is 43 years old and she is married with one son.  As the main source of income for her family, Nazira raises livestock, a business she started 20 years ago with the purchase of animals for 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has four cows, one horse and 20 sheep.  Nazira also has a rented plot of land on which she grows potatoes, lucerne and wheat.  Her monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of increasing her farm's output, Nazira has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two dairy cows to increase her head of livestock and to produce organic milk.  She plans to use reinvest the income from the loan back into the farm by further increasing her head of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase her volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Zharkynai

texts.ru: Жаркынай, 29 лет, замужем, мама 2 детей. У Жаркынай среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 11 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 5 овец. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, что позволит ей отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Zharkynai is 29 years old and she is married with two children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business 11 years ago and thanks to her hard work, Zharkynai now has two cows and five sheep on her farm.  Her business brings her about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  With the goal of developing her business further, she has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep.  Zharkynai plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her business so she will be able to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy five sheep in order to increase her business

loans.name: Nuriyla

texts.ru: Нурийла, 51 год, замужем, 3 детей. У Нурийлы среднее образование, с 2000 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Нурийлы на сегодняшний день имеется корова и 6 овец. Нурийла обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Нурийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nuriyla is 51 years old and she is married with three children.  She has a high school education and she has been raising livestock as the main source of income for her family since 2000.  Thanks to her hard work, Nuriyla now has six sheep on her farm.  She has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep to fatten and resell.  Nuriyla plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her business.

loans.use: to buy five sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Rodah's Group

texts.en:
Rodah, pictured above, has been a farmer for 7 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. She is 37 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Rodah likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Rodah plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy more land to cultivate.

In total, Rodah’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. As some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Gulzara

texts.ru: Гулзара 24 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Гулзара в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2010 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулзара на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 3 овцы. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает арбузы, дыни, хлопок для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для парника, семян и удобрений, чтобы выращивать экологически чистые продукты. Доходы от кредита Гулзара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность построить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulzara is 24 years old and she is married with two children.  As an extra source of income for her family, Gulzara raises livestock and grows crops.  She started doing this in 2010 and thanks to her hard work, she now has three cows and three sheep.  She also has a 1-hectare plot of land on which she grows watermelons, melons and cotton for resale.  With the goal of developing her business further, Gulzara has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 140,000 som (KGS) to buy plastic sheeting for her greenhouse, seeds and fertilizer to grow her organic products.  She plans to reinvest the income from the loan back into her business so she will have a chance to build a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic for her greenhouse, as well seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic products

loans.name: Kimizai

texts.ru: Кимизай, 55 лет, в разводе, есть дочь- школьница. У Кимизай среднее образование. Она старается жить в согласии и дружбе со всеми. Кимизай на пенсии, уже 37 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Кимизай у нее есть 31 корова. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кимизай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Кимизай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своей деятельности, ремонт дома и покупку бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en: Kimizai is 55 years old and she is divorced with a school-aged daughter.  Kimizai has a high school education and she tries to live peacefully with everyone.  She is a pensioner who has been raising livestock for 37 years.  Thanks to her hard work, Kimizai has 31 cows.  With the goal of developing her business further, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 10 sheep.  She plans to reinvest the income from the loan back into her business, as well as to make repairs on her home and to buy some appliances.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar solution to increase productive hours and her income.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal has cows. He has been in this business for many years. He is married and has two children. Kamal's elder daughter is married, and his younger son is studying at University. His lovely wife Madina helps Kamal with the family business. He buys little calves, raises them and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. They are living in the Fuzuli region, but  they are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from the occupied territory of Fuzuli city. 

Kamal needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN. With this loan, he wants to buy calves. He is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for everything. In the future, Kamal wants to help his son to build a house.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Nuriza

texts.ru: Нуриза, 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Нуризы среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 13 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Нуризы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется:  корова, 10 овец. На участке, мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 1,20 Га собственной земли, она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуриза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нуриза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и воспитание ее детей.
texts.en: Nuriza is 30 years old and she is married with two children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock and grows crops as the main source of income for her family.  Nuriza started this business about 13 years ago and thanks to her hard work, her farm now has one cow and ten sheep.  She also has a rented one-hectare plot of land and her own 1.2-hectare plot, on which she grows beans.  Her monthly income is about 8,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Nuriza has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy 10 sheep to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use this loan to further increase her head of livestock and to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ndombi's Group

texts.en:
Ndombi is 48 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Ndombi has been farming with One Acre Fund for some years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Ndombi also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Ndombi's Group will be able to receive a total of 2 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man and has no children. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, he has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that he is requesting of 40,000 KES, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her 3 children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family and has been running his own mobile shop for past 5 years. 

Nasra's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Nasra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Nasra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her husband's mobile business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the conditions in his home by building an indoor lavatory and installing sewage pipes.

loans.name: Koech

texts.en:
Koech is a 25-year-old smallholder farmer from Chemoner village in Bomet county of Kenya. Like most of the farmers in the area, Koech practices dairy farming. He started only four years ago, but has managed to grow from scratch to having 0.75 acres of land, three cows, five heads of poultry and several dairy goats. Koech also holds a salary-paying job. 

In a bid to grow his rural enterprise, Koech is seeking a loan investment of KES 60,000 from Kiva lenders to buy an additional dairy cow. Milk that will be produced by the additional cow is estimated to increase his current production by 25-30%. The increase in income from this investment will be plowed back into the business as capital for expansion.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her semester fees and complete her education

loans.name: Jose Elber

texts.es:
Jose tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de tres años en casa de material rústico que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú, su población se dedica a la agricultura en especial al cultivo de café, plátanos, crianza de animales menores y comercio de los mismos.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore, resistente a enfermedades y plagas, esta actividad la realiza hace tres años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café porque anteriormente a cultivado diversas variedades. Adicionalmente cria ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 4 reses de su propiedad, tambien cria de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, asegurando una buena producción lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and lives with his partner and three-year-old son in a house built with rustic materials in the Pimpingos district. Pimpingos is in Cutervo province, in the Cajamarca region of Peru’s northern highlands. The people here mainly make a living in farming, often growing coffee and plantains, and breeding and selling small animals.

José makes a living selling Catimore coffee, which is resistant to disease and pests. He has been doing this work for three years and has experience in it as he previously grew a diverse range of coffees. José also raising bovine cattle, and has four bulls in his possession. In addition, José breeds smaller animals such as hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and more.

This loan will be used to buy manure and fertilisers to look after José’s coffee crops. This will ensure good production, which will be reflected in higher sales and a better income. José can then use this income to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Khalaf

texts.en:
Khalaf is a 32-year-old divorced man with no children who lives in Southern Ghour.

After his unsuccesful marriage, Khalaf wanted to start a new life and to begin to achieve his childhood dreams. 

His most important goal is to get a master's degree in legitimate judiciary, therefore he has requested an education loan to cover his semester fees and to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To cover his semester fees and achieve his dreams

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 34-year-old woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; he sells apples, bananas, grapes and other fruit. Her husband alone is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Tahira's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruit for his business. Therefore, Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase fruit for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Martar's Group

texts.en:
Martar is 54 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Martar is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Martar started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Martar’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights. With this loan, the group will receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants, Abla est âgée de 33 ans. Restauratrice, Abla vit à Adidogomé et vend de la pâte bandée en se promenant dans les quartiers pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des maïs servant à la préparation, Abla demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif et afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Abla is 33 years old, married and mother to two children.  She lives in Adidogomé and sells maize meal on foot throughout her local district.  Once a month she buys more supplies for her business from the market.

Abla has requested this loan so she can buy maize to prepare and sell.  This will generate enough profit to support her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of maize for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has one daughter who is studying. 

Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 2 years. Her husband alone is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Razia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. With the help of this loan amount he will also be able to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.
  
Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in increasing his clothes business

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée de 35 ans et très entreprenante. Adjo vit à Apédokoè avec son enfant. Adjo travaille activement pour lui favoriser une bonne éducation. Pour cela Adjo vend des friperies dans son quartier pour trouver le revenu nécessaire. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois marché. Pour commander des tricots et des culottes, Adjo demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et réaliser plus de profits pour élever son enfant.
texts.en:
Adjo is 35 years old, married and very enterprising.  She lives in Apédokoè with her child.  Adjo works hard to provide an education for her child.  She sells second-hand clothing in her local district.  Once a month she buys more supplies for her business from the market.

Adjo has requested this loan so she can buy sweaters and underwear to sell.  This will generate enough profit to help her raise her child.

loans.use: to buy 75 sweaters and 50 pieces of underwear for resale.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Adjo est une femme qui a deux enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Adjo est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotideiennes. Adjo vend descharbons de bois à la devanture de sa maison et réalise un revenu favorable. Adjo s’approvisionne au marché cinq fois par mois. Adjo sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et avoir son propre magasin de distribution pour faire assez de profits.
texts.en:
Adjo is 36 years old and has two children in her care.  She lives in Adidogomé and is very dynamic, she works hard to provide for the day-to-day expenses of her household.  Adjo sells charcoal from the front of her house and makes a good living.  Five times a month she buys more supplies for her business from the market.

Adjo has requested this loan so she can buy sacks of charcoal to sell.  She would also like to have her own distribution shop to increase her profit levels.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abu.  He is married and has three children aged 14, 9 and 1. He has one additional dependent who lives with him as a foster child. 

In 2002, Abu established his business selling skirts, blouses and trousers. He used to assist his uncle in the business. After some time, his uncle gave him some amount of money to start his own business to be able to take care of his family. His main customers are women. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abu requires a loan in order to buy additional dozens of skirts, midis, trousers and blouses. He hopes that this loan will help to increase stock and maximize profit. In the future, Abu plans to complete his building project, open a shop, become an international businessman, and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for dozens of skirts, midis, trousers and blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution for her utensils store to increase the productive hours and income.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Irbid. He is 27 years old and married with one child.

He is working in a medical lab, but Mohammad has a lot of other dreams he wants to achieve.  The most important one is to complete his higher education.

He has a bachelor degree in medical labs and now he wants to get a master degree in same field.  He can not cover his education fees alone, therefore, he decided to apply for an education loan to help him pay the university fees and to help him achieve his goals.   

Perhaps this will give him a chance to find better work with a better salary to improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to help pay for university fees.

loans.name: Yèrèdèmè Group

texts.fr:
Séba est celle qui a levé les mains avec les légumes en mains.
Séba  est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont un scolarisé ; ses enfants  sont âgés de12 à 1 ans, son conjoint est paysan et emboucheur ; ils habitent ensemble dans un village d’agriculteur  au Mali.
Séba, en plus de ménage elle fait  le jardinage pendant la saison sèche. Dans son jardin, on y trouve des choux, des tomates, de l’oignon des poivrons d’aubergines de la salade, des piments et autres.
Elle rêve du bien-être de sa famille et surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.
Elle prend de l’argent avec le RMCR pour acheter plus de semence amélioré afin de faire une production de qualité dans  son jardin. Séba affirme que si elle achète une boite de semence de tomate, elle peut  avoir une somme de 75.000fcfa à 100.000fcfa à la cueillette. Elle s’approvisionne au marché et revend dans le même marché.
En  période de chaleur, les lentilles rouge détruisent les tomates  les choux et les poivrons, c’est pourquoi après Février nous sessions de les planté. Nous n’achetons pas d’engrais chimique pour mettre dans  le jardin mais  les plantes sont entretenues avec l’engrais organique générés par les animaux. Ainsi les produits sont de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
Séba is seen in the photo with her hands raised and holding vegetables.  She is 35 years old, married and mother to five children, one of whom attends school.  Her children are aged between one and twelve years old.  Her husband is a farmer and raises livestock.  They live together in an agricultural village in Mali.  As well as working in her home, Séba grows vegetables during the dry season.  There are cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, aubergines, salad leaf and chillies growing in her garden.

Séba dreams of protecting the well-being of her family and providing for the education of her children.  She works with the field partner, RMCR, to have enough money to buy good quality seeds to improve her production levels.  For every box of tomato seeds that she buys, Séba can make 75,000 - 100,000 francs CFA at harvest time.

She buys her seeds from the market and then sells her produce at the same market.  

During the hot season, vegetables are destroyed by pests and disease so planting ceases after February.  Séba doesn't use chemical fertilizers, prefering to use organic fertilizer generated by animals, this gives better quality vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her vegetable growing business.

loans.name: Layla Group

texts.en:
Kholoud is the featured borrower for Layla Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and live at the same time.

Kholoud is a 25-year-old married mother of one child who has worked as a cosmetics saleswoman for six years to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Kholoud is the first lady on the left in the photo. With respect to the other group members, Khadija is the lady sitting in the middle, and Layla is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants 2" Groupe Civilisé N°1

texts.fr:
Le GIE Épouses des enseignants »Groupe civilisés n°1 », rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
 Une dame de 43 appelée Mame Moussou est la présidente de ce sous-groupe ; elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle gère une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 10 ans. Actuellement son capital tourne autour de 750 000f. Ce crédit sollicité lui permettra de renforcer quelques marchandises manquantes dans sa boutique comme le sucre, le thé, le lait, le café… qui est le stock le plus rapide à écouler.
Mame Moussou veut diversifier son activité en ouvrant une mercerie et en y vendant des tissus.
texts.en:
The 'Epouses des enseignants - Groupe civilisés No. 1' Group is made up of teachers and wives of teachers who work in retail.  They have joined together to support one another and benefit from the loans on offer.  This will be their first loan with the field partner, UIMCEC.

Moussou is 43 years old and is the president of the group.  She is married and has children.  Moussou has been running a general food shop for more than ten years.  Currently she has a working capital of around 750,000 francs CFA.  Her loan will be used to buy new stocks of products such as sugar, tea, milk and coffee.  These are the products that sell the fastest.  

In the future, Moussou would like to diversify her business and open a mercer's shop, selling fabric

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Oroub

texts.en:
Oroub is a 19-year-old student. Oroub is a single lady who is very simple and ambitious. She lives in Irbid with her family that has seven members. She wants to be someone important in the future.

Oroub is studying at university to be a class teacher. Oroub's reason for applying for the loan is to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Yabom
