texts.en: This is Yabom. She is married, and has one child, aged ten. In 2007, Yabom established her palm oil business. She used to help her friends with the business on a commission basis, then she started doing her own business to support herself and her child. Her customers are mostly women. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,250,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy additional gallons of palm oil, bags of rice and groundnuts. She hopes that this loan will help to expand the business and generate more income. In the future, Yabom plans to buy a piece of land to expand the business and educate her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dorcas's Group

texts.en:
Dorcas, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Dorcas will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Dorcas plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Dorcas’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her husband's shop and buy more tools to increase the quality of his work

loans.name: Fordson's Group

texts.en:
This season is not the first one that Fordson is working alongside One Acre Fund. He has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2007 and, although he is the only person featured in the above picture, is representing his group of eight farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Fordson is often described by his community as a very friendly person and decided to be the one to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. Like many of his fellow farmers, Fordson decided to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to buy a goat. He is also so excited to be purchasing a solar light so that his children will have light during dark hours to study.

This loan will help not only Fordson but the whole group, which will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. Additionally, farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light and, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 26 years old, and married without children. He could not complete his study because of his family's financial problems, but he realized that the certificate is the only weapon in life. Omar started his education journey and he is majoring in something he likes to do which is graphic design. He asked for an education loan to pay for his tuition fees, study materials and books.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees, study materials and books

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 52 years old and residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailor shop in the local market for 2 years.  He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Zahida's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business. 

Therefore, Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will be able to financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs.  In this way, he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Zahida is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Gul Naz

texts.en:
Gul Naz is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Gul Naz is also providing sewing services to earn income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods for her business, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Gul Naz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 60 años de edad es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de refrescos, sodas, frutas y golosinas en la entrada de su comunidad por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre la buscan por la amabilidad con la que los atiende. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos a los que apoya para que estudien y se superen. Ana desea mejorar su negocio ya que en verano la afluencia de personas es mayor y las ventas mejoran por las altas temperaturas, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sodas, refrescos, jugos, frutas y golosinas y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana, 60, is a humble, hard-working woman who sells soft drinks, sodas, fruits and sweets at the entrance of her community.  She has a good number of customers who always seek her out for her kind attention.  She lives with her life partner and their three children who she supports so they can get an education and improve their situation.

Ana wants to improve her business since there is more demand in the summer and sales increase with the high temperatures.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy sodas, soft drinks, juices, fruits and sweets to increase sales and earnings.

loans.use: To buy sodas, soft drinks, juices, fruits and sweets.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos de edades 13, 7 y 1 mes de nacido, en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera como camas, ventanas, roperos, entre otros, para ofrecerlo a sus clientes, cuenta con experiencia en este sector y sus clientes dan muy buenas referencias de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de madera para elaborar sus muebles, con esto Elmer espera ofrecer unos mejores productos a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y por ende tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer, 35, lives in his own rustic-style house with his wife and three minor children, ages 13, 7, and a month-old baby, in the district of Pucara.  The village people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the province of Jaen which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Elmer makes wooden furniture such as beds, window frames, wardrobes and other items for his customers.  He has experience in the sector and receives very good references from his customers.  He has requested a loan to buy a greater quantity of wood to make furniture.  Elmer hopes to offer better products to his customers in order to increase his earnings and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a calf for grazing and to strengthen his business for continued progress.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is married and has been blessed with two children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. He cites food and electricity bills as his major challenges.

Juma operates a business selling fruit juice, which he makes and sells at retail to his neighbors and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when business is low. 

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase sacks of fruits for making fruit juice for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for making fruit juice for sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana nació en un lugar llamado Bocaysito en el año de 1990 ahí vivió hasta la edad de 16 años, ella estudio toda su primaria en la escuela de la comunidad luego decidió estudiar su secundaria a Diana le gustaba estudiar y  le ayudaba a trabajar en la casa a la madre fue así que aprendió las labores del hogar. Actualmente esta casada y tiene dos hijos . Ella y su esposo se dedican a la siembra del cafe y granos básicos. En su comunidad no hay luz electrica y a ella le gustaría tener luz en su hogar y por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y este sistema vendría a ser un bien mas para el hogar y de mucha utilidad ya que por las madrugadas cuando ella se levanta a hacer la comida para los trabajadores en tiempo de corte se tiene que estar alumbrando con foco y para acostarse tiene que estar encendiendo candelas para arreglar la cama y ya con este panel solar comenta ella ya va a ser todo diferente hasta a los niños le va a servir cuando estén estudiando, ella estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Diana was born in 1990 in a place called Bocaysito, where she lived until she was 16.  She received her primary education at the community school but then decided to study secondary because she enjoyed studying.  She also helped her mother at home and learned about housework.  Now she is married and has two children.  She and her husband grow coffee and basic grains.

There is no electricity in her community and she would like to have electric light at home.  Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system which would be very helpful in the household when she gets up early in the morning to make meals for the workers during harvest season.  Now she has to use a lantern and at night she uses candles to go to bed.  With the solar panel it will all change and the children will even be able to study.  She is very grateful for the loan opportunity so she can buy the solar system.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy consumables and pay labourers to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos de 11,10 y 4 años en una comunidad rural ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con dos herramientas, una mototaxi y una moto cargera propias con las cuales brinda este servicio, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que cuenta con clientela fija de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino. El préstamo lo va invertir en realizar reparaciones y arreglos a sus unidades móviles ya que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto Benito espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le servirán para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Benito, 46, lives in his own house with his wife and three minor children, ages 11, 10 and 4, in a rural community in the district of Pomahuaca.  It is in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.  The village people in this district work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming, mainly.

Benito runs a transportation service and has two vehicles, a motortaxi and a motorcycle which he uses in his business.  He has over three years' experience in the sector and steady customers in the area.  He also raises and sells goats.  The loan will be used to repair his vehicles which are in bad condition.  Benito hopes to offer better service to his customers in order to earn more income and enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: To repair his vehicles which are in bad condition.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Las cremas, los perfumes, los cosméticos colonias etc, son los ariculos con los que Luz Elena genera  ingresos, para apoyar los gastos de su hogar, en el que habita con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años. Hace 2 años, impulsada por su madre, mujer comerciante con experiencia de 20 años, quien le aconsejó dedicarse a la actividad comercial, como efectivamente lo hizo y desde entonces no se ha detenido. Hoy las metas de Luz Elena son superiores y por eso se empeña en mas adelante hacer ampliaciones locativas, remodelar su vivienda, para lo cual trabajará fuertemente con el fin de incrmentar sus ventas y superar el desafio de fidelizar la clientela con buenos precios y un buen servicio. En la actualidad está aplciando a un credikiva, primer finaciemtnfinanciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos capilares y de belleza, para lograr su propósito inmediato, que justamente se constituye en el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Creams, perfumes, cosmetics, colognes, etc. are the items with which Luz Elena earns her income to support the household expenses, where she lives with her spouse and her 7-year-old son. Two years ago, she was inspired by her mother, a businesswoman with 20 years of experience, who advised her to work in a commercial job. She did that and since then has not stopped.  Today, Luz Elena's goals are higher and for this, she is going into debt so that in the future she can make expansions to her retail space and remodel her house, for which she will work hard with the end of increasing her sales and overcoming the challenge of creating a loyal customer base with good prices and good service. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase hair and beauty products to achieve her immediate goal, which actually consists in the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive en casa de su madre junto a su familia, se separó de su esposa y ella se quedó con la custodia del hijo de ambos, no cuenta con ayuda económica del extranjero, dentro de su familia aprendió a dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pollos, su negocio está funcionando desde hace 3 años, sus labores las realiza de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, es así como obtiene ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Necesita comprar pollos y concentrado para establecer mejor la granja, la inversión será de utilidad para mejorar las ventas y tener una situación financiera más favorable para darle a su familia lo necesario para subsistir.
Sueña con cancelar su deuda, instalar una venta de lácteos para ofrecer otro tipo de producto a sus clientes y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Víctor lives in his mother's house with his family. He separated from his wife and she has custody of their children. He does not have any help from abroad. In his family, he learned to raise and sell chickens. His business has been running for 3 years. He works from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon. This is how he gets income to cover the family's expenses.

He needs chickens and concentrate to better establish his farm. The investment will be useful to improve sales and have a more favorable financial situation to give his family what they need to subsist. 

He dreams of paying off his debt, opening a dairy store to offer his customers another type of products, and building his own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrate to better establish his farm. The investment will be useful to improve sales and have a more favorable financial situation.

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es:
Delia, tiene 47 años, tiene 3 hijos, está divorciada, viven en casa propia en el barrio de Santa Isabel de Pilascacho que pertenece a Andrade Marín de Atuntaqui, por el sector que ella vive la gente se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales y también a la confección de prendas de vestir además es un sector tranquilo sin delincuencia y brindan platos típicos como las fritadas.
Delia se dedica al comercio de animales desde hace 16 años atrás es su actividad primordial además de su comercio tiene otro ingreso del trabajo de empleada, en su actividad del comercio vende pollos, cuyes, chanchos de donde tiene ingresos para todas las necesidades que le presentan al mes y así mismo también tiene ingresos para los gastos de la educación a pesar de estar sola sigue educando a sus hijos de buena manera para que en el futuro sean personas de bien y que sean ejemplo de los hogares que ellos formen en el futuro.
El crédito que solicita en Fundación Alternativa lo va utilizar en la compra de más animales para seguir realizando el comercio y así mismo agradece por todo el apoyo que le siguen brindando para seguir creciendo en su negocio
texts.en:
Delia is 47 years old. She has 3 children and is divorced. She lives in her own house in the neighborhood of Santa Isabel de Pilascacho, which belongs to  Andrade Marín de Atuntaqui. In the area where she lives, people work as merchants, raising animals, and also making clothing. It is also a peaceful area without any crime and they sell traditional food such as fritadas.

Delia has worked selling animals for 16 years. It is her main activity and in addition to her business she has another source of income, which is her work as a maid.In her business she sells chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. From that she has income for education expenses. Despite being on her own, she continues to educate her children in a good way so that in the future they will be upright people and be exemplary in the families they start in the future. 

The loan she is asking Fundación Alternativa for will be used to buy more animals to keep doing her business. She is grateful for the support she is continuing to receive to keep growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy more animals and keep educating her children.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, paciente, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Llanquichapi’ situado a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca, los pobladores viven de la pesca y la agricultura, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Nicolasa es de tez es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que son mayores de edad y no trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuanta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la pesca, trabajo que comienza por la noche cuando extiende las redes de pesca para recogerlas por la madrugada, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana a la misma hora, las variedades más comunes son; pejerrey, trucha, Karachi, mauri, ispi, y otros. “pesco desde que era niña porque acompañaba a mi papá a trabajar, actualmente ellos no trabajan y yo me encargo de mantener mi hogar…” comenta. Su sueño es construir una casa para sus padres de ladrillo y cemento, ella desea realizar la compra de redes de pescar y darle mantenimiento a su bote, para continuar con su trabajo y cuidar a sus padres. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nicolasa solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar y darle mantenimiento a su bote para trabajar y cuidar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 35-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is fishing. 

She is enterprising, independent, patient, understanding, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the Llanquichapi community located on the banks of the sacred Lake Titicaca. Its inhabitants live by fishing and agriculture, it has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Nicolasa has dark skin, long black hair that she wears braided, dark eyes, is short, has a robust physique, and she dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She lives her life in the company of her parents who are older and don't work. They live in their own house made of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting with electricity and well water. Her business is fishing, work that begins during the night when she spreads her fishing nets to collect them in the early morning, work that she does every day of the week at the same time. The most common varieties are silversmelt, trout, pupfish, catfish, and more. "I have fished since I was a girl because I went with my father to work. Currently, they don't work and I am in charge of supporting my household..." she says. Her dream is to build a house for her parents from brick and cement. She wants to purchase fishing nets and do repairs on her boat, to continue with her work and care for her parents. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 13 years she has been doing this work independently.  

For these reasons, Nicolasa asks for a loan to purchase fishing nets and do repairs on her work boat, and to care for her parents.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and do repairs on her work boat and to care for her parents.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Doña Emerita todods los dias desde las 3 de la mañana está lista para vender carne, en su negocio ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad. Ella trabaja fuertemente en un horario que se extiende por 12 horas, con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y llevar a sus hijos un mayor bienestar, pues en su condicion de viuda debe sustentar todos los gastos de su hogar y es madre de 3 hijos. Su negocio inció en el año 1985 , cuando despues de aprender de la expereincia de su tio, para quien trabajaba, decidió encargarse de él y desde entonces no se ha detenido. Higado, panza, carne de res etc, son los productos alimenticios que vende por kilos y que le dan la posibilidad de tener ingresos todos los dias. Su meta mas adelante es tener un segundo puesto de trabajo estrategicamente ubicado, para que sus ingresos mejoren aun mas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva pues requiere de comprar en un mayor volumen que como actualmente lo hace, con el fin de acceder a mejores precios por compras por mayoreo, haciendo de su credito una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Every day Emerita is ready at 3 in the morning to sell meat in her business in the city market. She works hard with a schedule that lasts 12 hours in order to improve her living conditions and bring well being to her children. As a widow, she must pay for all of the household expenses and she is the mother of 3 children. She started her business in 1985, when after learning about her uncles' experience, for whom she worked, she decided to take over for him and  since then she hasn't stopped. Liver, stomach, beef, etc., are the food products that she sells by the kilo and that give her the possibility to have income every day. Her goal in the future is to have a second sales stall that is strategically located, so that her income will improve even more. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan because she needs to buy in greater quantities than she is doing now in order to access better proves by buying in bulk. This will make her loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy tripe in greater quantities.

loans.name: Macherlyn

texts.es: Macherlyn de 35 años de edad, dese hace 1 año se dedica a la actividad comercial, impulsada por la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportarle a los gastos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 1 y 2 años.  Ropa, calzado, perfumería y mucho más, son los productos que vende Macherlyn directamente al consumidor final, mediante créditos que otorga a su clientela conformada por los vecinos, amigos y referenciados por sus compradores actuales. Sus compras las realiza de contado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar ubicado a 35 minutos de su municipio,  donde encuentra los mejores precios para hacer una oferta ajustada al bolsillo de su clientela y lograr sostenerse en el mercado. Para Macherlyn su más importante meta actual es fortalecer su capital de trabajo, para aumentar sus utilidades y más adelante tener su propia casa y educar a sus hijos con los niveles de calidad que requiere. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, y otras variedades ajustándose a los pedidos de su clientela y a las temporadas que marcan estas solicitudes de sus compradores. Con esta inversión Macherlyn fortalecerá su capital de trabajo aumentarán sus ventas y así mismo las utilidades del negocio, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Macherlyn, 35 years old, has worked in sales for the past 1 year, inspired by the need to generate income to contribute to the household expenses, which is made up of her spouse and 2 children, ages 1 and 2.  Clothing, shoes, perfume, and much more, are the products that Macherlyn sells directly to the end consumer, through loans that she grants her customers, who are her neighbors, friends and people referred by the current customers. She makes her purchases in cash in the city center of Barranquilla, a place located 35 minutes from her municipality, where the best prices are found to make an offer that fits her customer's budget and manage to sustain herself in the market. For Macherlyn, her most important current goal is to strengthen her working capital to increase her utility and in the future have her own house and educate her children with the level of quality they need. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase clothing, shoes, and other things, meeting her customers' orders and in the season that these orders are made by her customers. With this investment, Macherlyn will strengthen her working capital, which will increase her sales and also her business's utility, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and other products for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in juices, sodas, cold drinks, sweets, and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags for her nursery, urea fertilizer, Alto 100, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es: Silvana de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas hace 1 año, cuando en una construcción los trabajadores no solucionaban su necesidad de almuerzar facilmente; así fue como Silvana vio esta situación como su oportunidad de generar ingresos, para apoyar el sustento de su hogar conformado por su conyuge y sus dos  hijo de 5 y 6 años de edad. Hoy en su negoci,  ella   empieza su dia de trabajo preparando sus instalaciones en su propia cas y a las 9 de la mañana empieza el proceso de cocción. Su tarea se extiende hasta las 3 de la tarde, pues lleva los almuerzos hasta el lugar donde estan los trabajadores y posteriormente se dedica al aseo limpieza de su espacio de trabajo. Silvana compra todos los dias en graneros cercanos de contado y vende a crédito y de contado a trabajadores de construcciones, oficinas etc y hasta sus propios vecinos tambien le compran. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante y mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda, pero aun tiene el desafio de lograr incrmentar sus clientes . Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, pirmer finaciemtno que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual compará una estufa e insumos alimenticios, para aumentar su producción y con ello impactar el deseo de compra de su clientela, lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Silvana, 30, has been selling food for a year. She realized that workers from a construction site complained because they did not have where to eat lunch. She saw a business opportunity and the possibility to generate income and contribute to the family’s economy. She lives with her husband and two children aged 5 and 6.

Every day, she starts preparing the ingredients at home. At 09:00 am she starts cooking and works until 03:00 pm. She has to take the food to the workers and then clean before she leaves. Silvana pays in cash for the ingredients. Some of her customers pay in cash, some pay later. Her customers are construction workers, office workers and even neighbors. Her dream is to have a great restaurant and be able to improve her living conditions. 

Her challenge is to attract more customers. This is why she is for the first time requesting a CrediKiva from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a stove and ingredients in order to increase her production and attract more customers, which is why she thinks this will be a good investment.

loans.use: to buy a stove and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz y leña a precios bajos, espera aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta para tener materia prima suficiente para elaborar la venta de tortillas.
Al tener la ayuda de un crédito Kiva ha logrado que su negocio sea más competitivo, la nueva situación económica le permite salir adelante con su familia y reducir su nivel de endeudamiento.
texts.en:
Norma is requesting a new loan to buy corn and firewood at low prices. She hopes to take advantage of an opportunity she has to buy enough ingredients to make and sell tortillas.

With the help of Kiva loans, her business has become more competitive. Her new financial situation allows her to get ahead with her family and reduce the level of debt.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood at low prices

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone recharge cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca hails from Kiptulwa village, where she owns 17 acres of fertile agricultural land. She solely heads a family of nine children. She has been able to provide for all her children by practicing dairy farming. 

Rebecca started farming 25 years ago. Today, her main source of income is milk. 

To boost her family's income, Rebecca is applying for a loan of KES 41,600 to buy a dairy cow. Having a sixth cow will increase her milk production and the number of animals (asset base) on the farm. 

Your investment will enable Rebecca to make more income for her family, and to have more collateral to leverage her business in future to drive growth.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
ABIZERWA is a group led by Yvonna, who is 35 years old. The group name means “trust” in English. She is married with three children, aged between 3 and 15 years. Two of them go to school. She has a bar, and has been doing business for the past two years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer, soda and water to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and water .

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is 22 years old and lives with her family in Irbid. She is single and a student at the university, majoring in computer information systems.

Samah wants to complete her education to find job with responsibility and to grow, not just professionally, but personally too. But, her family faced financial problems so they could not pay her semester fee; therefore she asked for an education loan to pay for her tuition fee and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fee and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for school. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years he has operated a barber shop business, his potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially men. He dreams of expanding his business to meet his family's basic needs. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase a shaving machine, chairs and repair the walls in his place of operation. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine, chairs and repair the walls in his place of operation.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Mwanaisha rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonlity and transportation as major challenges in her business.
 
With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham was shocked after her husband died, and that is not weird for a woman who lost her husband after five months of their marriage.
She was very upset and sad, but she tries to change all these feelings to positive energy. 

After a while, she decided to complete her education and get a Master's degree in Business Administration; therefore she applied for an education loan to help her pay the university fees and achieve her dreams.

Perhaps this will help her to overcome the difficult stages that she suffered after the death of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotion. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotion

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
This season is not the first one that Andrew is working alongside One Acre Fund. He has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2011 and, although he is the only person featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Andrew is often described by his community as a very trustworthy person and decided to be the one to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. Like many of his fellow farmers, Andrew decided he wanted to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to earn enough to send his children to school and hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to rent more land to cultivate.

This loan will not only help Andrew but the whole group, who will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 10.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Sri Jagannath Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Sri Jagannath Shg-A was formed with three members in 2014 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Lily as to be highlighted here. 

The lady standing first from left in the photograph is Lily. She is a 22-year-old woman living with her husband and her one child. For five years, Lily’s husband has been working as a farmer to provide for his small family, but his income is not sufficient to manage the family's needs. So Lily is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has two years experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can increase her family’s income. Lily says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her child to a good school. This way, she can provide a better education to her son.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder and to make a cow shed.

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
Waed is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in Irbid. She has one sister who works in a sewing shop. Waed is a third year student at university majoring in translation.

Waed's parents are facing financial problems. This has led Waed to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees. Her future plan is to find a good job so she can help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: To apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees

loans.name: Sri Jagannath Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sunita is a 32-year-old lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children, 10 and 7 years old, in a small village in Koraput district in Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady standing left is Sunita. 

She is engaged in rice paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Sunita formed a group with Jayanti from her village and named the group "Sri Jagannath SHG-C."  Both women are are engaged in same business activity to alleviate their poverty. Sunita is the president of this group. She motivated Jayanti to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. 

Sunita, along with Jayanti, requested a loan of 24,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her rice paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sri Jagannath Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sri Jagannath SHG-B is composed of three women from a small village of Koraput district in Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in activities such as vegetable cultivation, milk selling, paddy and maize cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women with a willingness to learn new business trends.They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Ranjita, is highlighted here. The lady standing first from left is Ranjita. Ranjita is 30 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children who are 10 and 6 years old. She does vegetable cultivation. She produces vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, lady fingers, onions, etc. and sells them at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Ranjita in vegetable selling at the market. Ranjita is planning to buy standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so she can produce more vegetables and can increase her income.

Ranjita, along with Lalita and Binapani, is asking for a loan amount of 36,000 INR to invest in their business activities. She wants to give a better education to her children. She says, on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sanamati is a 33-year-old lady living with her husband and son in a small village named Badapada in the Koraput district. In the picture, the lady standing first from right is Sanamati. Her husband is a farmer. He spends all day at the farm. Her son is at school. During the day, she has all day free, so she decided to form a self-help group. She gathered two of her neighbor women and formed a group named Jay Hanuman SHG-C. Sanamati was selected as the featured borrower of the group. 

Sanamati has a plan to cultivate watermelon and sell it at the market so that she can make a handsome profit. For this reason, she and her group members are requesting this loan. She will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her watermelon farming. After this investment, she will be earning and supporting her family. She is very happy that she is able do something that is worthy of her leisure time.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her watermelon farming.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants" Groupe Civilisés N°2"

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants »Groupe civilisés n°2 », rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
Maty, 36 ans, est la représentante du sous groupe. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC comme d’ailleurs ses consœurs. Maty gère une mercerie dans le marché ; elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat de garnitures comme du fil, des boutons, de la popeline etc. achetés pour être revendus dans la boutique. Dans une période sans événements, ni fêtes, Maty peut encaisser au minimum dix mille francs par jour et 25 000f pour les périodes de fêtes. Ce qui n’est pas négligeable car elle gère ses besoins personnels avec.
Elle veut développer son activité et diversifier ses produits et services.
texts.en: The Group 'GIE Epouses des Enseignants' convenes teachers and/or wives of teachers who are involved in commercial activities. They have joined the network in order to support each other, but also to benefit from improved access to financing. They are asking for their first loan from IMCEC. Maty, 36 years old, is the representative of the group. She has never asked for a IMCEC loan before, unlike several of her groupmates. Maty manages a haberdashery in the market; she is asking for a loan in order to purcahse merchandise such as thread, buttons, poplin, etc, that she purchases and then resells. During a season without events or holidays, Maty's sales reach up to a minimum of 10 000 FCFA per day, and 25 000 FCFA during the holiday season, which she uses to cover personal expenses. She hopes to continue developing her boutique and diversify the products and services offerred.

loans.use: purchase sewing acessories (thread, poplin, buttons, lining) to sell in her haberdashery

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Desde hace 15 años, Ramiro inició su generador de ingresos independiente vendiendo frutas por todas las calles de la ciudad, pero no le fue bien y por eso decidió pensarlo mejor y se instaló en sun sitio altamente comercial donde logró superar sus pérdidas, ubicando allí su carreta con la oferta del dia. Hoy las frutas tropicales de buena calidad  tiene Ramiro en su oferta y con esto ha logrado sostener a su familia. Ramiro vende de contado y compra todos los dias para conservar la frescura de las frutas, que vende principalmente a los trabajadores del sector, que son los fieles impulsadores de sus ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en un mayor volumen, mandarinas, mangos, sandias etc y tambien hará adecuaciones a su carreta, para que su imagen resalte mucho mas y cada fruta tenga su propio espacio. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio donde ofrecer sus productos, pero para ello debe superar el desafio de aumentar sus ganancias y esto es justamente lo que busca con su credikiva..
texts.en: Fifteen years ago, Ramiro started generating income independently by selling fruits at all streets of the city, but he did not do well. Therefore, he decided to set himself at a highly commercial spot where he was able to overcome his losses by installing there his fruit cart with the sale of the day. Nowadays, Ramiro offers tropical fruits of good quality, and with this he has been able to support his family. Ramiro sells on a cash basis, and buys daily in order to always have fresh fruits, which he mainly sells to the workers of the area, loyal boosters of his earnings. Currently, he is applying to a credikiva, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy more volume of mandarins, mangos, watermelons, etc., and also will make improvements to his cart in order to highlight his image and give each fruit its own space. His goal in the future is to have his own store from where to offer his products. For this he has to overcome the challenge of increasing his earnings, and this is exactly what he is looking for with his credikiva.

loans.use: to buy more amount of mandarins, mangos, watermelons, etc., and also to make some improvements to his cart.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa jeune femme de 32ans vit avec son enfant de 14ans qui est scolarisé à Lomé. Elle a appris la coiffure et a ouvert un atelier dans lequel elle vend des produits de beauté et des mèches depuis 2014. Elle se fait aidée par 01 personne et désire un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Elle espère agrandir son commerce et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Yawa is a young 32 year old woman, who lives ih Lomé with her 14 year old child, who attends school. She learned hairdressing and opened a boutique from which she has been selling beauty products and hair strands since 2014. She is assisted by one person, and is asking for her first loan in order to purchase merchandise to satisfy her customers. She hopes to grow her business and take care of the needs of her family.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions and strands

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a 36-year-old married woman from Kazreti borough. She has two school-aged sons and a husband who works in a private organization. Irina has been unable to find a stable job as, in their region, there is a high unemployment rate. Therefore, she has started trading in clothing and linen household items. Irina earns her own small income and has the great desire to somehow increase her productivity. 

Irina plans to open a confectioner's shop and has requested a loan. Through the Start-Up program created by Kiva and Credo, Irina has been able to borrow a loan of 3,500 GEL to start a baking business. She will renovate the shop and will connect the water and power. Irina will bake various kinds of cakes and pastries and will sell locally at good prices. Irina thinks that the business will be profitable as it is in a great location and will be the only business of this kind in the area. 

After the confectioner's shop is open, Irina will have a stable income which will enable her to cover everyday costs as well as to expand the business in future. With support of the Start-Up program, Irina will have the opportunity to be involved in her own stable business and to tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a confectioner's shop to generate a stable income

loans.name: Concephter's Group

texts.en:
Concephter, aged 36, is the proud mother of seven children. She is often described as a very experienced farmer and, as the group leader, is representing her group of 16 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Concephter has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Concephter described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. In addition to fertilizer and maize seeds, Concephter is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light. She will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Concephter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 10.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 18 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sri Jagannath Shg-D Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support Pratima. She is a member of “Sri Jagannath SHG-D" self-help group. In this photo, she is the lady standing right. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their one child together.

Both the women are working in dairy farming in a village of Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India. With her portion of the loan, Pratima will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. After this loan, Pratima will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Pratima is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm. 

The second member of this group belongs to the same community. She plans to save the money she earns from expanding her businesses to buy a food processing machine, which she and Pratima can use to make spices and pickle vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
From a small village of Koraput district, Odisha state, India, three women stepped out and made a self-help group having the name of "Maa Baman Dei SHG-A" to earn some money from different activities to support their families. The group members are engaged in various business activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Nabina, age 32, is a married lady with one daughter. The lady standing middle in the photograph is Nabina. To provide her living, she has been planting rice and farming for seven years. Her farming earns an income of 3,500 INR per month. 

Now she is the leader of this group, and they are seeking their first loan with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner) for 36,000 INR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her rice will yield a good crop for her to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Shg Group

texts.en:
Nilabati is a 31-year-old illiterate woman who lives in Koraput district, Odisha. In the picture, the lady standing first from left is Nilabati. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

It had been difficult for her to manage her family with her husband’s income. Then she got to know about Kiva and she formed a self-help group named Jay Hanuman SHG with some other women of her village. She performs as the featured borrower of the group with the support of other members. Their group has decided to take a loan from Kiva and start agricultural businesses like vegetable, flower, and paddy cultivation. All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities. 

Nilabati requested this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes she will be financially literate, stable and independent and live a much better life than before. She is grateful to Kiva for this help.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Nabina is a believer and also a mother of one child. They belong to Badapada village of Koraput district. In the picture, the lady standing first from left is Nabina, the middle one is Sakiladebi and the third one is Satyabati. 

Nabina has the responsibility of her family on her and she understood that it was not going to be a smooth life with only the income of her husband. So she stepped out of her home to earn money. She formed a self-help group named Jay Hanuman SHG-B with two other women of her village and the support of People's Forum. She took charge of her group as the president. 

Now she is a 31-year-old lady who is completely independent herself and supporting her family and her husband financially. Currently, she is engaged in vegetable and flower cultivation and selling. She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming and flower businesses. She hopes to build a house for her family and wants to educate her child. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming and flower businesses.

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en:
Fathi, aged 21, lives in Irbid. He is a student at art college majoring in drama. Fathi is one of six family members. His dad is retired and his pension is not enough to cover Fathi's education fees in addition to the household expenses.

Fathi will not let anything prevent him from his education. Therefore, he has requested an educational loan to help him cover his university fees and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to cover his university fees and achieve his goals

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°3 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE « Epouses des enseignants n°3 », regroupent des femmes enseignantes et/ou dont les maris sont enseignants. Ce rassemblement est né il y a quelques années et les activités divergent selon les membres.
 La dame Mama, 44 ans, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon, a 19 ans et la cadette, 3 ans. Mama s’active dans la couture depuis plus de 5 ans, elle possède son propre atelier et fait de la confection et de l’exposition-vente. 
Avec le crédit, elle pourra acheter des tissus divers à la mode, de la garniture, fil, renfort, coudre pour revendre.
Mama a l’ambition d’agrandir son atelier, de renforcer le matériel et les employés afin d’augmenter la production et le profit.
texts.en: The group « Epouses des enseignants n°3 » convenes female teachers and/or spouses of male teachers. The group was formed several years ago, and with its members involved in diverse activities. Mama, 44 years old, is responsible for the group. She is the mother of 5 children, the oldest a 19 year old boy, and the youngest 3 years old. Mama has been involved in sewing for more than 5 years, and has her own workshop from which she fashions clothes, show them off and sells them. With this loan, she will be able to purchase diverse fashionable cloths, fixings, thread and lining, and sew clothes to be sold.  Mama hopes to grow her workshop, to increase the number of materials she uses and hire more people, in order to increase her production capacity and profit.

loans.use: purchase cloth to make into clothes and resell

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en:
Zamzam is a 32-year-old married woman from Baniswef. She has four school children. Her husband has a small kiosk in his village in which he makes and sells tea. He earns a very small income so Zamzam decided to start a domestic plastic goods' business. She has bought the goods for the shop on instalment so her income is very low.

Zamzam has requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy domestic plastic goods with cash so she can increase her sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: To buy domestic plastic goods with cash so she can increase her sales and earn a higher income.

loans.name: Anoiting Group

texts.en:
This group has two members: the leader is Akua, who makes a living selling charcoal and onions from the wholesale market in the city of Accra. This is her 10th loan cycle with the organization, and Akua (standing on the right in the photo) is going to use this loan amount of GHS 2,500 to buy more charcoal and onions to restock her business, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Akua is a very hard-working person, and she is grateful for the opportunity provided, because this loan will allow her to grow her business. She is a 50-year-old single mother of one child. She and her colleague need GHS 2,900 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and onions to restock her business.

loans.name: J E L C Shg-C Group

texts.en:
J E L C Self Help Group-C consists of 3 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. One of them is Daita who was selected as their president. 

Daita is a 51-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children. The lady standing first from right is Daita. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a variety shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, grains, lentils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Daita has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to meet her customers' demands. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. For this, she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables. Daita, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR.

loans.use: To purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables for her variety shop.

loans.name: Isaiah's Group

texts.en:
Isaiah's Group consists of 14 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Isaiah, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 36 years old,  married, and has three children. Isaiah has been a farmer for 20 years and is referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Isaiah joined One Acre Fund in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest. This year, Isaiah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Isaiah's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 11 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Thoraya

texts.en:
Thoraya is 46 years old and divorced. She is from Minia and lives with her aging and diseased parents. She is the only breadwinner of the family. 

Thoraya operates a veterinary medications sales project, which she has been doing for five years. Although her project is successful, she does not have enough money to buy more medication to continue her sales and meet the demands of her customers. Thoraya requested a loan from TADE for 2,500 EGP, which she will use to buy more and new veterinary medications for her shop to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase veterinary medications for her shop

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est une femme mariée âgée de 25 ans et vit à Apédokoè. Ami a deux enfants à sa charge et pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, Ami vend des charbons de bois pour gagner la rentabilité nécessaire pour son épanouissement. Ami s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché pour acheter ses articles. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants, Ami demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Ami is a married 25 year old woman who lives in Apédokoè. She is responsible for two children, and in order to support her family, Ami sells charcoal to cover the cost of the family's needs. Ami stocks up on her merchandise four times a month at the market. In order to have a sizeable stock and to maximize her profits in order to help her husband take care of the education of the children, Ami is asking for a loan to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.use: acheter 3 sacs de charbons de bois

loans.name: Francis's Group

texts.en:
Francis, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very hard-working individual. This is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Francis is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District and, this year, is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time.

Francis has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will purchase not only farming inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, but also two solar lights. Francis is very happy to be getting the lights as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Francis is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Francis's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 19 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is the married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Margaret's greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Margaret has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 that Margaret is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Maa Jagat Janani Shg-B Group

texts.en:
The Maa Jagat Janani Self Help Group-B is formed by ten members originally from the Koraput district of Odisha, India. These three members are highlighted here. They are responsible married women. They have five children under their responsibility. They are all hardworking with hopes to self-improve.

Jhili is the featured borrower of the group. Her activity is a variety store located in her house. The lady standing first from the left hand side is Jhili. She sells basic products such as rice, beans, wheat flour, bread, eggs, sugar, tomatoes, potatoes, and other household consumables.

This loan is needed for working capital to stock her store and satisfy the demand from her clients. Jhili, along with Lata and Kumari, has requested a loan of 36,000 Indian rupees (INR) to enhance their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase products for her variety store such as rice, wheat flour, beans, bread, eggs, sugar, tomatoes, potatoes, and other household consumables.

loans.name: J E L C Shg -A Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the J E L C Self-Help Group-A. One of them is Ranjita, age 24. In the picture, the lady standing first from the left is Ranjita. 

Ranjita lives with her husband and parent-in-law in a village. She alternates her daily activities with a business of selling rice, grams, spices, wafers, hair oil and other household consumables. She runs a small shop where she sells all these things to support her family. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and she does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also sells vegetables in her shop. 

She requests the loan to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables for her business. She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to making her payments as scheduled. The businesses of the other group members Bharti and Jem are a dairy farm and a tailoring shop respectively.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables to sell.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty is 26 years old and is often described as a very hard-working individual. She is married and has three children. As her group's leader, Betty is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya. She is very excited this year to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Betty's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, such as cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. This is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Betty and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights as well as loans for farm inputs of maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-B Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Baman Dei SHG-B" a newly formed group, is made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation. 

Lachhama is the lady in the picture who is standing middle, the featured borrower of the group. She is 28 years old and she has two children. She cultivates and sells paddy rice and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than seven years. Her father helps her in this business. 

With her new loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers for her paddy farming. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings so as to better establish her business. The other members of this group, Namini and Nabi, are engaged in milk selling and fish selling respectively.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for her paddy farming.

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a 32-year-old housewife from the Koraput district of Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing in middle is Basanti. She is the featured borrower of the Maa Baman Dei SHG-C. Her husband is a vegetable vendor and earns 4,000 INR per month, which is insufficient to cover the family's household expenses. 

Basanti wanted to share the burden of her husband, so she formed a self-help group of three members and convinced them to work on a piece of land to cultivate and sell their harvest in the village. She was successful in this small step taken by her to grow more vegetables on a larger scale and sell fresh vegetables, not just in her village but also in the nearby village. She hopes to be a vegetable dealer and supplier of the village who can supply all the demand of the vegetable market. Therefore, she requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and vegetable baskets. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and vegetable baskets.

loans.name: Maa Jagat Janani Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Lagani is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lagani was born in the Koraput district of Odisha, India 48 years ago. The lady standing first from the left in the photo is Lagani. She is married, and the couple has two children who are attending school. For nine years now, Lagani has been selling rice, cooking oil, lentils, spices, onions, and packaged food items like biscuits, cake, etc. in her grocery shop.

Lagani, along with her group members, has applied for a loan of 36,000 INR. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Lagani will use her share of the loan to expand her business. She will buy biscuits, chocolate, lentils, rice, wafers, detergent, salt, pepper, shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, chocolate, lentils, rice, wafers, detergent, salt, pepper, shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Maa Baman Dei SHG-D Group consists of two members who are women. These two entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start some business activities where they could provide the basic household consumables, vegetables, fruits, etc. to their customers. Jema, the lady standing right in the picture, owns a grocery shop and Santosi is engaged in vegetable and fruit selling. 

Jema is a 37-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children who are at their schooling. Her husband works as a farmer. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan. 

She says on the behalf of the group, "We are grateful to the Kiva and its lenders for providing us this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: To purchase grocery items in bulk directly from the wholesalers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Senhor Luís tem 31 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 2 filhos dos quais a mais velha estuda frequentando o ensino primário, é polícia, vive em casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe.
O montante financiado será aplicado na compra de sumos, cervejas, refrescos, massas, ovos, farinha, para iniciar um negócio visto que acaba de terminar a construção da sua mercearia.
No futuro espera construir uma ferragem de modo a aumentar a renda familiar visto que agora é o único a trabalhar e torna difícil o sustento.
O seu maior desafio é de arranjar emprego para esposa visto encontra se desempregada de forma a incrementar a renda familiar bem como terminar a construção da sua casa que veêm construindo a 8 anos.
texts.en:
Mr Luís is 31 years old, married and the father of 2 children, the oldest of whom goes to primary school. He's a policeman, lives in a house he owns and also supports his mother.

This loan will be used to buy juices, beers, sodas, pasta, eggs and flour to start a business, given that he has just finished building his grocery store.

In future he hopes to build a hardware store in order to increase his family's income as he is the only one currently working and it becomes difficult to support them all.

His biggest challenge is to find a job for his wife - who is currently unemployed - so as to increase the family's income as well as to finish building their home which has been under construction for the last 8 years.

loans.use: buy juices, beers, sodas, pasta, eggs and flour for resale.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, con el apoyo y buena administración de los créditos a realizado en el tiempo justo los trabajos de agricultura, cuenta que las cosechas de sus cultivos son más abundantes y la situación económica poco a poco está mejorando, la familia está más unida que nunca y le apoya para mantener su negocio.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar  abono, insecticidas, semilla mejorada y herbicidas, para llevar a cabo el cultivo de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Jose has accomplished his farming work in good time, through the support and good administration of the loans. 

His  harvests are more abundant, he comments, and his financial situation is improving little by little. His family is more united than ever and supports him in maintaining his business.

He decided to request a new loan to purchase compost, insecticides, improved seeds and herbicides, in order to grow basic grains.

loans.use: to purchase compost, insecticides, improved seeds, and herbicides for the cultivation of basic grains.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group-B

texts.en:
In 2015, three women from a village stepped out and formed a group named Maa Tarini Group-B. They help each other, share their problems and solve them together. They are celebrating their festivals together in their village. 

Padma, the featured borrower of the group, has one cow. The lady standing first from the right in the photo is Padma. She wants to purchase one new cow so that she can sell the milk in large amounts. She provides vaccines and fodder to them when it's required. She sells the milk in her village with the help of her husband. 

Every morning, she takes the cow to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her cow by feeding it at home. Her husband assists her in selling the milk and maintaining the cow. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. 

She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase one more cow. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all the expenditures of her business. She has requested a loan of 36,000 INR for her group so that they can earn more and control their families' cash flow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her dairy business

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group-C

texts.en:
Champa is 29 years old, married and has two children who are studying in school. She lives in the village of Badanaikguda of Odisha, India. Champa is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business farming her paddy (rice) and selling her crops in the market in Koraput district in Odisha, India. She already has had this business for six years, and it is going very well. 

At this time, Champa is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands. 

This group is made up of neighbors who formed the Maa Tarini Group-C. Both members of the group have selected Champa as their featured borrower. The lady standing on the right in the photo is Champa. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and tools for cultivating paddy (rice).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more varied clothes and purses.

loans.name: Kenet Wilford

texts.es: KENET WILFORD: Es un joven alegre y jovial de 27 años de edad, casado con un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Trabaja como docente de escuela primaria. Con el propósito de celebrarle el cumpleaños a su hijo, solicita financiamiento para comprarle ropa, calzado, pastel, debido a que con su bajo salario no le alcanza. El sueña en continuar con sus estudios, terminar su especialidad en matemáticas para ser docente universitario y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: KENET WILFORD is a happy and jovial 27 year old youth. He is married and has a young 3 year old son. He works as a teacher at a Primary school. With the goal of celebrating his son's birthday. He is requesting a loan to buy clothing, footwear and a birthday cake as his low salary can't cover this. He dreams of continuing his studies and finishing his specialty in mathematics to become a university professor and provide a higher quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear for his son for his 4th birthday party.

loans.name: Fabriciano

texts.es:
Fabriciano tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en compania de sucónyuge, sus dos hijas y su nieto. Vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, su vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz y se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore, tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta ubicada su parcela de café, esta actividad la realiza hace 05 años en el distrito de Pimpingos, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y de animales menores como gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fabriciano is 44 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his spouse and his two sons ans a grandchild. He lives in a small community where people work mainly in agriculture and raising livestock. His house has water and electricity and is located in the district of Pimpingos, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

Fabriciano works growing Catimore varietal coffee. He has his own agricultural land where his coffee plot is located.
