loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida sends you her thanks for your generosity. Her previous loan had entrenched her transportation business. She was able to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. The loan also helped her pay for her children's educational expenses and daily needs.

Aside from the tricycle that she operates, Aida also manages a food stall. She sells snacks like salty garlic peanuts, kornik (deep-fried corn kernels), crunchy peas, sweet-salty anchovies and other street food staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She likewise earns well from this. Her minimum sales every day is PHP 1,000.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Aida dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she uses in her business.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N° 11 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE « Epouses des enseignants n°11 », regroupent des femmes enseignantes et/ou dont les maris sont enseignants. Ce rassemblement est né il y a quelques années et les activités divergent selon les membres.
Madame Hélène, 42 ans est la présidente ; elle est mariée et mère d’une fillette de 4 ans. Elle s’active dans la revente de poulets de chair déjà à terme depuis 2 ans, elle ne fait pas l’élevage proprement dit. Elle possède aussi un réfrigérateur ou elle vend de la glace et de la crème. Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité, lui permettent d’honorer ses tontines mensuelles.
Hélène souhaite ouvrir une boutique sous forme de mini épicerie pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The borrowers’ group “Teachers’ spouses #11” is composed of women who are  teachers themselves and/or are married to teachers. This group was created a few years ago, and its members are engaged in various types of business activities.
 
Mrs. Helene, 42 years old, is the group’s leader. She is married and has a four-year old daughter. She has been selling broiler chickens for two years. She sells chickens who are already grown and does not breed poultry, strictly speaking. She also owns a refrigerator and sells ice and ice cream. The revenues from this activity allow her to make monthly contribution to her “tontine” [a neighborhood savings group].
Helene would like to open a mini-grocery in order to diversify her activities.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens for resale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married 37-year-old woman with eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She is in the agriculture business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has one child in school. She has an electronics store business in the Philippines. 

Josefina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy electronics to sell like a television, etc. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell like a television, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Maria has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 40 years old and has four children, one child in school.

Liliosa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Liliosa requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Liliosa has been in this business for 18 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Liliosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock
